delegate.description:
A delegate containing common fields used by all assignable entities. These fields track:
  • The assignment status ("Assigned", "Unassigned" and so on)
  • The current assignee - a queue or user and their corresponding group
  • The previous assignee - a queue or user and their corresponding group
  • The user who last assigned the entity
  • The time when the entity was last assigned
If an entity is assigned to a queue then the assigned group will be the queue's group. If an entity is assigned to a user then the assigned group will be one of the user's groups. Do not assign an entity to both a user and a queue. If an entity is assigned to a group it will usually also be assigned to a user or queue, though while assignment rules are running it may temporarily be assigned to just a group.

foreignKey.name: AssignedByUser
foreignKey.description: User who assigned this entity.

foreignKey.name: AssignedGroup
foreignKey.description: Group to which this entity is assigned; null if none assigned

foreignKey.name: AssignedQueue
foreignKey.description: Either the Queue to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the Queue to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

foreignKey.name: AssignedUser
foreignKey.description: Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

column.name: AssignmentDate
column.description: Time when entity last assigned

typekey.name: AssignmentStatus
typekey.description: Typelist describing assignment status.

column.name: CloseDate
column.description: Date and time when this entity was closed. (Not applicable to all assignable entities)

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

foreignKey.name: PreviousGroup
foreignKey.description: Group to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: PreviousQueue
foreignKey.description: Queue to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: PreviousUser
foreignKey.description: User to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: AssignedByUser
foreignKey.description: User who assigned this entity.

foreignKey.name: AssignedGroup
foreignKey.description: Group to which this entity is assigned; null if none assigned

foreignKey.name: AssignedQueue
foreignKey.description: Either the Queue to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the Queue to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

foreignKey.name: AssignedUser
foreignKey.description: Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeAndGroupDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing the current assignee plus their group, suitable for display to the user. This can be quite a long string, for example "Andy Applegate (Auto1 - TeamA)". See also {@link #getAssigneeDisplayString()} which omits the group name and may be more appropriate if space is tight.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing the current assignee, suitable for display to the user. See also {@link #getAssigneeAndGroupDisplayString()}, which returns a more detailed description of the assignee.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeGroupOnlyDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing only the group of the current assignee, suitable for display to the user. See also {@link #getAssigneeAndGroupDisplayString()}, which returns a more detailed description of the assignee.

column.name: AssignmentDate
column.description: Time when entity last assigned

typekey.name: AssignmentStatus
typekey.description: Typelist describing assignment status.

column.name: CloseDate
column.description: Date and time when this entity was closed. (Not applicable to all assignable entities)

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

foreignKey.name: PreviousGroup
foreignKey.description: Group to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: PreviousQueue
foreignKey.description: Queue to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: PreviousUser

derivedColumn.name: SuggestedAssignees
derivedColumn.description: Returns the suggested assignees for this entity, to be displayed in the UI as the most likely assignees when the user is assigning the entity. The list of assignees will depend on the type of entity, and will contain users who are somehow "involved" with the entity, associated claim, or currently assigned user and group.

column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: BasedOnUntyped
derivedColumn.description: Return the bean from which this bean was based (cloned), or null if this bean is new to this branch. This value will never change for the life of the bean as its set when the bean is first created, either as a bean new to this branch (in which case it's null) or when this bean is cloned from a bean in an existing branch when its branch is created. <p/> When compiling DiffItems a bean is always compared to it's based-on bean to discover what fields on it have changed. If there is no based-on bean then we know that this bean was new to this branch.

derivedColumn.name: BranchUntyped
derivedColumn.description: Return the branch associated with this bean. This can never be null, and will never change. A bean will always be associated with the same branch.

typekey.name: ChangeType
typekey.description: Type of change made to this row

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

derivedColumn.name: EffDatedKey
derivedColumn.description: Get an effective date independent key for this bean. This key will include the BranchId and the FixedId. This is the key for the "logical" bean. <p/> An EffDatedKey only really applies to EffDateds as an EffDatedBranch is the same throughout its effective range (or its period range) so there is no difference between the "logical" bean and the actual bean.

column.name: EffectiveDate
column.description: Effective date of this row. A value of NULL in the database indicates that this row's effective date is equal to the Period Start.

column.name: ExpirationDate
column.description: Expiration date of this row. A value of NULL in the database indicates that this row's expiration date is equal to the Period End.

derivedColumn.name: FixedId
derivedColumn.description: Get the logical ID for this bean, not the row ID. All row

derivedColumn.name: Promoted
derivedColumn.description: Check if this bean or branch has been promoted. A promoted bean is also locked and cannot be changed. <p/> An EffDated is never promoted independent of its related EffDatedBranch, meaning if the branch is promoted every bean in the graph will be promoted, and if the branch is not promoted no bean in the graph can be promoted.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Slice
derivedColumn.description: Whether this bean is sliced. If a bean is sliced then you can navigate from this bean to another bean or beans via a link or array, if it's unsliced (in "window" mode) you cannot navigate from this bean. <p/> In most cases a bean will be sliced, window mode is used in special cases.

derivedColumn.name: SliceDate
derivedColumn.description: Date which this bean is "sliced" or viewed. If you traverse from this bean to another bean or beans via a link or array, only beans that are effective at this slice date will be returned. The beans that are returned will be sliced at this date as well. If NULL then the bean is in "window" mode. <p/> In most cases a bean will be sliced, window mode is used in special cases.

derivedColumn.name: UnslicedUntyped
derivedColumn.description: Return the unsliced version of this bean. If the bean is already unsliced then returns itself.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

derivedColumn.name: VersionList
derivedColumn.description: Get the version list for this bean. An EffDatedVersionList is a representation of a logical bean through its effective range. For example, if a bean has changes at three separate effective dates then the version list will comprise 3 versions of the bean, one for each of these dates. <p/> You can use an EffDatedVersionList to traverse from this bean to other linked beans in window mode. Recall that in window mode you cannot traverse links directly from the bean. <p/> Although an EffDatedBranch only has a single version throughout its effective range you can still get its EffDatedVersionList in order to navigate in window mode from the branch to its related EffDateds.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser

Call this once then cache the result if you know that the beans won't change while you use this information.

column.name: MostRecentModel

derivedColumn.name: NewPeriod

derivedColumn.name: NewSubmission
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if this branch represents a new submission.

column.name: PeriodEnd
column.description: Upper bound of all expiration dates of this root

derivedColumn.name: PeriodId
derivedColumn.description: Every branch belongs to a period, identified by its PeriodId. When a new submission or renewal is created the new branch is assigned a new PeriodId. When a new branch is created in the same period as another branch (e.g. a policy change) it shares the "based on" or "original" branch's PeriodId. A period often has several branches associated with it, both promoted and in draft, but will have only one "most recent" or "in-force" branch associated with it. This in-force branch is the most recently promoted branch associated with a period. The other promoted branches represent earlier versions of the in-force branch in model-time. Often when we refer to the "period" we're actually referring to the most recently bound branch in a period, ignoring the other, "older" branches that are also associated with the period. <p/> To find all the branches associated with a period find all branches with the same PeriodId.

column.name: PeriodStart
column.description: Lower bound of all effective dates of this root

column.name: Preempted
column.description: True if when bound this branch has been preempted

derivedColumn.name: Promoted
derivedColumn.description: Check if this bean or branch has been promoted. A promoted bean is also locked and cannot be changed. <p/> An EffDated is never promoted independent of its related EffDatedBranch, meaning if the branch is promoted every bean in the graph will be promoted, and if the branch is not promoted no bean in the graph can be promoted.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: ResolveWithFuturePeriods
derivedColumn.description: When a branch is promoted and there exists a future bound period (or periods, but multiple would be rare) then this method returns true until it is cleared. <p/> This value can then be checked later to see if you want to apply the changes on this branch to that future period. Once it's cleared you will no longer have that option.

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

derivedColumn.name: Slice
derivedColumn.description: Whether this bean is sliced. If a bean is sliced then you can navigate from this bean to another bean or beans via a link or array, if it's unsliced (in "window" mode) you cannot navigate from this bean. <p/> In most cases a bean will be sliced, window mode is used in special cases.

derivedColumn.name: SliceDate
derivedColumn.description: Date which this bean is "sliced" or viewed. If you traverse from this bean to another bean or beans via a link or array, only beans that are effective at this slice date will be returned. The beans that are returned will be sliced at this date as well. If NULL then the bean is in "window" mode. <p/> In most cases a bean will be sliced, window mode is used in special cases.

column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

Recall that in window mode you cannot traverse links directly from the bean. <p/> Although an EffDatedBranch only has a single version throughout its effective range you can still get its EffDatedVersionList in order to navigate in window mode from the branch to its related EffDateds.

delegate.description: Details of a match for a Claim or Exposure as returned by the Insurance Office Services (ISO) ClaimSearch service. If ISO ClaimSearch integration is enabled then descriptions of new or changed Claims or Exposures are sent to the ISO ClaimSearch service to see if any suspiciously similar claims have been filed at other companies. If ISO ClaimSearch returns a "match report", indicating that one or more similar claims have been filed, then the report is added to the claim as a document and the most important information from each reported match is stored in an ISOMatchReport entity.

column.name: ClaimNumber
column.description: Claim number of matching claim.

column.name: DateOfLoss

column.description: State of insuring company address.

column.description: Phone number of insuring company.

column.name: InsuringCompany

derivedColumn.name: ISOClaim
derivedColumn.description: The claim associated with this match report

derivedColumn.name: ISOExposure
derivedColumn.description: The exposure associated with this match report, or null if this is a claim level match report

derivedColumn.name: ISOReportable

column.name: MatchReasons

delegate.description: The delegate for TAccount and RITAccount. TAccounts are used in ClaimCenter to provide a rolled-up view of all financials transactions entered into the system. Each Reserve Line (unique combination of Claim, Exposure, Cost Type and Cost Category) has 22 distinct TAccounts that together represent every possible life cycle state for each of the four transaction subtypes (Payment, Reserve, Recovery and Recovery Reserve). The Taccounts occur in pairs; a debit account (example: ReservesXX, which holds the amount of a reserve) and a matching credit account (example: Cash Out). Every life cycle state transition for a transaction (e.g., from pending-approval to awaiting-submission) affects one debit and one credit T-account equally (example: a payment debits ReservesXX and credits Cash Out). ClaimCenter provides useful calculated values by combining the balances of various TAccounts as appropriate.

The delegate for TAccountLineItem types. An entry of a specific amount of money, either crediting or debiting one T-account. A TAccountTransaction will contain a pair of balancing TAccountLineItems - a debit to one T-account and an equal credit to another.

Delegate for the TAccountTransaction types (normal/plain and RI). Contains the TAccountLineItems that change a pair of T-accounts to account for a transaction as it moves through its LifeCycle States. For example, when a reserve becomes committed, it is debited (removed from) Pending Approval ReservesXX T-Account and added (credited) to the ReservesXX T-Account. Each TAccountTransaction has a link to its succeeding TAccountTransaction, thus providing a history of the life of the associated transaction. It may have 2 or 4 TAccountLineItemDelegates: 2 to undo previous contributions, and 2 to effect the new contributions. If one of the previous or target states does not have a T-account (i.e. New, Rejected), then there will be only 2 line items.

column.name: Comments
column.description: Comments about the transaction, such as the LifeCycleState transition for which it was created.

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

entity.description: Assigns work, reminds a user to complete a task, or provides notification of an event. An activity is typically associated with a claim, but some activities may also be associated with Service Requests, Exposures or Contacts (claimants). The Guidewire platform defines an ActivityBase entity that ClaimCenter can extend. Each activity is instantiated from an actvity template or pattern.

subtype.description: Aggregates the information needed to display one activity row in the activity desktop page (subtype of ActivityView).

derivedColumn.name: Claimant
derivedColumn.description: Returns the name of the Claimant associated with this activity.

derivedColumn.name: Exposure
derivedColumn.description: Returns the Exposure associated with this activity. If no exposure is directly associated, finds all exposures owned by the Claimant associated with this activity's claim.

derivedColumn.name: finder
derivedColumn.description: Instance of PublicActivityDesktopViewFinder.

derivedColumn.name: UpdatedSinceLastViewed
derivedColumn.description:
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this activity was updated since the last time it was viewed. The exact sequence is:
  1. Return false if the activity is not open
  2. Return false if the activity is not assigned to the current user
  3. Has the activity ever been viewed? If not (never viewed) return false if the current user created the activity, true otherwise
  4. Otherwise, return true if someone else has updated the activity since the current user viewed it, false otherwise

derivedColumn.name: UnassignedActivityUserReview
derivedColumn.description:
Returns the "user review status" of an unassigned Activity.
Logic is: - try Activity.RelatedActivity.AssignedUser - otherwise try Activity.Matter.AssignedUser - otherwise try Activity.Exposure.AssignedUser - otherwise try Activity.Claim.AssignedUser - otherwise empty string

  1. Return false if the activity is not open

  4. Otherwise, return true if someone else has updated the activity since the current user viewed it, false otherwise

entity.description:
Represents a street or mailing address. Addresses are normally associated with a Contact, either as a Primary Address for that Contact or via the ContactAddress table. Addresses can have geographic location information stored for proximity searches.

@see Contact @see ContactAddress

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: AddressBookUID
column.description: The system uses this value when it is integrated with ContactManager and the related contact is linked. In this case, the ID represents the ID of this Address object's associated ABAddress in ContactManager. This value is Null if the object is not linked.

column.name: AddressLine1
column.description: First line of mailing address.

column.name: AddressLine1Kanji
column.description: First line of mailing address in kanji (used only for Japanese addresses and will be null otherwise)

column.name: AddressLine2
column.description: Second line of mailing address.

column.name: AddressLine2Kanji
column.description: Second line of mailing address in kanji (used only for Japanese addresses and will be null otherwise)

column.name: AddressLine3
column.description: Third line of mailing address.

typekey.name: AddressType
typekey.description: Type of this address record.

column.name: BatchGeocode
column.description: Boolean field to mark an address to be geocoded (if needed) by the batch geocoding work queue.

column.name: CEDEX
column.description: CEDEX: Special business mail delivery flag (used only for French addresses and will be null otherwise)

column.name: CEDEXBureau
column.description: CEDEX: Special business mail delivery bureau (used only for French addresses and will be null otherwise)

column.name: CityKanji
column.description: City in kanji (used only for Japanese addresses and will be null otherwise)

derivedColumn.name: CityStateZip
derivedColumn.description: Returns City, State and ZIP in the standard "city, state ZIP" format

derivedColumn.name: CorrectionsFromGeocodingPlugin
derivedColumn.description: This gets a list of addresses which could match the provided address. The first result in the list is used as the best match found. This caps the number of results found. <p/> You can check if this is supported with a call to GeocodeUtils.currentPluginSupportsMultipleCorrections()

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

column.name: Description
column.description: Additional description of mailing address.

derivedColumn.name: DisplayAddressLine1
derivedColumn.description: Returns AddressLine1Kanji if it is populated, AddressLine1 otherwise

derivedColumn.name: DisplayCity
derivedColumn.description: Returns CityKanji if it is populated, City otherwise

derivedColumn.name: FailureGeocoding
derivedColumn.description: Checks if the location information (Latitude, Longitude and GeocodeStatus) has been successfully set.

typekey.name: GeocodeStatus
typekey.description: Enum giving the status of the latitude and longitude data.

derivedColumn.name: Latitude
derivedColumn.description: Latitude expressed in degrees. Positive = North; Negative = South: -90 <= x <= 90

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

derivedColumn.name: Longitude
derivedColumn.description: Longitude expressed in degrees relative to the prime meridian. Positive = East; Negative = West: -180 <= x < 180

derivedColumn.name: Map
derivedColumn.description: Gets a URL to a map showing this address. If not supported by the current geocode plugin, returns null. Uses the system-default unit of distance.

derivedColumn.name: NeverGeocoded
derivedColumn.description: Checks if the location information (Latitude, Longitude and GeocodeStatus) has been successfully set.

column.name: PostalCode
column.description: Postal code; string to handle Zip+4 and international codes.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.name: SpatialPoint
column.description: Latitude and longitude of this address, represented as an instance of SpatialPoint.

typekey.name: Subtype
typekey.description: Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value

derivedColumn.name: SuccessfullyGeocoded
derivedColumn.description: Checks if the location information (Latitude, Longitude and GeocodeStatus) has been successfully set.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

column.name: ValidUntil
column.description: Latest date that this address is valid.

entity.description: Encapsulates a copy of those fields within a persistent Address which represent a physical address, at the point in time it was Geocoded, and any corrected fields received upon Geocoding that Address.<p/> AddressCorrection entities will not be created for temporary Address, if no corrections are received, or if Geocoding fails for that Address. If an Address is edited more than once, and the Geocoding is updated, more than one AddressCorrection may exist for a given address.<p/> Note that the corrected address may not capture all information from the original; in particular, MapPoint will discard apartment/suite/floor/mailstop numbers. Similarly, "duplicate" corrections may be produced.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

foreignKey.name: Address

column.name: CorrectedState

typekey.name: Country

entity.description: Defines an annual or lifetime limit on an insurer's liability. This entity's LimitAmount value defines the maximum amount that an insurer is required to pay for a specific period. Each CoverageLine, which represents either a CoverageType or a specific Coverage, has an associated AggregateLimit and they are linked together through the CoverageLineLimit entity. The AggregateLimit.CoverageLines array contains the lines that reference a particular AggregateLimit. Each AggregateLimit is associated with a single policy period and zero or more coverage lines. If associated with multiple coverage lines, all the lines must be unique.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

typekey.name: AggLimitCalcCriteria
typekey.description: Contribution critiera for limit used calculations

derivedColumn.name: ApplicableClaimAggregateLimitRpts
derivedColumn.description: Returns the list of ClaimAggregateLimitRpts that pertain to this limit.

derivedColumn.name: ApplicableNonZeroClaimAggregateLimitRpts
derivedColumn.description: Returns the list of non-zero ClaimAggregateLimitRpts that pertain to this limit.

derivedColumn.name: ClaimCurrency
derivedColumn.description: Currency of any Claim in the PolicyPeriod. They should all have same currency, if an AggLimit exists. If the AggLimit's PolicyPeriod is null (i.e. the limit is new or being edited), the default system currency is returned.

column.name: Comments
column.description: Comments about the aggregate limit.

array.name: CoverageLines
array.description: Coverage lines that reference this aggregate limit.

derivedColumn.name: CoverageNames
derivedColumn.description: Returns a concatenation of the names of the coverage lines on this limit separated by commas and with the format: CoverageLine.CoverageSubtype #CoverageLine.ExposureUnitNumber.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

derivedColumn.name: FinancialsCalculationDescription
derivedColumn.description: This is determined by the Policy Type of the Aggregate Limit's PolicyPeriod, for Policy-Level limits

column.name: LimitAmount
column.description: The amount of the aggregate limit, in the Claim Currency of Claims in the PolicyPeriod.

derivedColumn.name: LimitRemaining
derivedColumn.description: Return the remaining unused amount of this aggregate limit. Specifically, this amount is equal to the limit amount minus the amount used. If the difference is negative, then zero is returned.

typekey.name: LimitType
typekey.description: Aggregate limit type: none, by loss date, or by reported date.

derivedColumn.name: LimitUsed
derivedColumn.description: Returns the amount used (a.k.a. realized) of this aggregate limit, in ClaimCurrency.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

foreignKey.name: PolicyPeriod
foreignKey.description: PolicyPeriod with which the aggregate limit is associated.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

column.name: Valid
column.description: Indicates if the AggregateLimitRpts related to this aggregatelimit are up-to-date.

typekey.name: ValueType
typekey.description: Aggregate type: limit or deductible.

entity.description: A queue of assignable entities. Entities can be assigned to a queue (rather than a user) and any entity assigned to a queue is said to be "in the queue". A queue belongs to a group and is typically used to organize items which can be handled by any user in its group. When a user has time to tackle a new item they look at the items in the queue and reassign the top item to themselves.

column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: Name
column.description: The name of this queue.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

entity.description: The top level entity for Bulk Pay, which corresponds to the incoming invoice or bill to be paid. It has a unique ID (which may correspond to the invoice), some data fields (such as payee and a scheduled send date), and a non-null array of bulk invoice items (refer to the BulkInvoiceItem entity for details). A bulk invoice is not associated with a single claim, but each line item (each BulkInvoiceItem) is associated with a different claim.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: AccountName
column.description: The name on the account

column.name: ApprovalDate
column.description: The date when the object was ultimately approved or rejected

derivedColumn.name: ApprovalHistory
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves all the approval activities for this Bulk Invoice, typically so that a history view can be generated.

typekey.name: ApprovalStatus
typekey.description: The approval status of the object

derivedColumn.name: ApprovedCurrencyAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the currency and sum of all approved items' amounts of this invoice, as a CurrencyAmount.

derivedColumn.name: ApprovedInvoiceItems
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves only the approved BulkInvoiceItems contained by this BulkInvoice. Note that this method currently does a direct query to the database, so it should only used used for a non-new invoice, and it will not return accurate results if one or more inserted/updated/removed invoice items are pending commit to the database.

column.name: ApprovedReportingAmount
column.description: Denormalized value of amount in reporting currency of all approved invoice items.

column.name: ApprovedTransactionAmount
column.description: Denormalized value of amount in transaction currency of all approved invoice items.

column.name: BankAccountNumber
column.description: The bank account number

typekey.name: BankAccountType
typekey.description: The type of bank accout e.g. checking, savings etc

column.name: BankName
column.description: The name of the bank

column.name: BankRoutingNumber
column.description: The routing number is a nine digit bank code used in the United States

derivedColumn.name: BulkInvoiceAmountComponent
derivedColumn.description: Returns the invoice amount and currency of this invoice, as an IMutableMoney.

column.name: BulkInvoiceTotal
column.description: Amount to be split evenly across all invoice items, or zero if item amounts are to be entered individually.

derivedColumn.name: BulkInvoiceValid
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this bulk invoice is currently valid (i.e., has been validated successfully and had no meaningful change since).

typekey.name: CheckInstructions
typekey.description: Special handling instructions for the check.

column.name: CheckNumber
column.description: The check or EFT identifier for the single large check generated for this invoice.

column.name: Comments
column.description: Comments about the check, such as a reason it was voided.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

typekey.name: Currency
typekey.description: Currency that the line items on this BulkInvoice should use.

derivedColumn.name: DeductionsSum
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves the sum of all deductions' amounts. Note that this method currently does a direct query to the database for any non-new invoice, so in that case the returned amount may be inaccurate if this method is called after one or more BulkInvoiceItems have been added/update/removed and before a database commit.

typekey.name: DefaultCostCategory
typekey.description: The CostCategory, if any, shared by every payment on this BulkInvoice unless overriden by a particular line-item.

typekey.name: DefaultCostType
typekey.description: The CostType, if any, shared by every payment on this BulkInvoice unless overriden by a particular line-item.

typekey.name: DefaultPaymentType
typekey.description: The PaymentType, if any, shared by every payment on this BulkInvoice unless overriden by a particular line-item.

derivedColumn.name: Deletable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this BulkInvoice can be deleted.

derivedColumn.name: Deleteable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this BulkInvoice can be deleted.

typekey.name: DeliveryMethod
typekey.description: Requested delivery method for the bulk check.

derivedColumn.name: Editable
derivedColumn.description:
Tests whether this BulkInvoice is editable. A BulkInvoice is editable if the status is any of the following:

  • {@link BulkInvoiceStatus#TC_DRAFT}
  • {@link BulkInvoiceStatus#TC_INREVIEW}
  • {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION}

or, if the status is {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceStatus#TC_PENDINGITEMVALIDATION} and it's been marked as EditableWhilePending. This only happens if one or more BulkInvoiceItems were approved but then failed validation or their checks failed validation.

array.name: InvoiceItems
array.description: The collection of BulkInvoiceItems on this invoice, corresponding to the line-items on the real-world invoice.

column.name: InvoiceNumber
column.description: Unique number of the physical invoice related to this bulk pay invoice.

column.name: IsPrimary
column.description: Indicates if this is the primary EFT record for the contact

column.name: IssueDate
column.description: Date the check was issued.

derivedColumn.name: LastApprovingUser
derivedColumn.description: The last user who approved this BulkInvoice. <p/> For example, if User A submits a BulkInvoice for approval, then the LastApprovingUser is User A. Suppose that BulkInvoice then requires approval by User B. When User B approves the TransactionSet, then the LastApprovingUser becomes User B. And so on . . . <p/> Note: This method should only be called from BulkInvoice Approval Routing and BulkInvoice Approval Rules. If this method is called from any other ruleset, it may throw an NPE.

column.name: LastValidatedDate
column.description: The date that this BulkInvoice was last validated. This property is always non-null when Valid is true.

column.name: MailTo
column.description: Name of the person/company to whom the check should be mailed.

column.name: MailToAddress
column.description: Address of the person/company to whom the check should be mailed.

column.name: Memo
column.description: Memo to include on the check.

derivedColumn.name: OverrideTransToReportingExchangeRate
derivedColumn.description: Returns whether this invoice has a custom exchange rate.

foreignKey.name: Payee
foreignKey.description: The Payee for all the bulkinvoiceitems on this bulkinvoice.

derivedColumn.name: PayeeChangeable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether the payee is changeable for the Bulk Invoice. This is only the case if the bulk invoice is editable, and none of its associated checks have yet been escalated.

typekey.name: PaymentMethod
typekey.description: Requested payment method for all payments in the check.

column.name: PayTo
column.description: Pay to the order of value for the bulk check.

derivedColumn.name: PendingItemValidation
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this bulk invoice is currently undergoing final processing, wherein all the bulk invoice items are validated and associated placeholder checks are created.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: ReceivedDate
column.description: Date that the invoice was received or entered.

typekey.name: Reportability
typekey.description: Whether the bulk payment should be reported to the IRS as income.

column.name: ReportableAmount
column.description: (Unused. May be removed in a future release.) Reportable amount of the BI check (for deductions).

foreignKey.name: RequestingUser
foreignKey.description: The user submitting the object for approval

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.name: ScheduledSendDate
column.description: Date that the bulk invoice should be submitted to the downstream system.

derivedColumn.name: SortedInvoiceItemsQuery
derivedColumn.description: Returns a QueryProcesser representing the set of BulkInvoiceItems for this BulkInvoice sorted by the default order. Currently we sort by the BulkInvoiceOrder field as the default.

column.name: SplitEqually
column.description: Designates whether or not the amount for each individual line-item should be automatically calculated as an even share of the total amount.

typekey.name: Status
typekey.description: Business status of this bulk invoice.

derivedColumn.name: Stoppable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this BulkInvoice can be stopped (only if it's been submitted to the downstream system).

derivedColumn.name: Submittable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this Bulk Invoice can be submitted for approval and final processing (i.e., its status is {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceStatus#TC_DRAFT}, it is valid and it has at least one BulkInvoiceItem).

derivedColumn.name: TotalAmountOfAllApprovedInvoiceItems
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves the aggregate amount of all approved, submitted, and submitting invoice items on this bulk invoice. Note that this method currently does a direct query to the database for any non-new invoice, so in that case the returned amount may be inaccurate if this method is called after one or more BulkInvoiceItems have been added/update/removed and before a database commit.

derivedColumn.name: TotalCurrencyAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the currency and sum of all items' amounts of this invoice, as a CurrencyAmount.

column.name: TotalReportingAmount
column.description: Denormalized value of total amount in reporting currency of all invoice items.

column.name: TotalTransactionAmount
column.description: Denormalized value of total amount in transaction currency of all invoice items.

foreignKey.name: TransToReportingExchangeRate
foreignKey.description: The Transaction-to-Reporting exchange rate used to select Transaction-to-Claim and Transaction-to-Reporting exchange rates for the checks created for this bulk invoice. If this refers to a market exchange rate, current market rates will be selected. Otherwise, a market Claim-to-Reporting exchange rate will be selected and a custom Transaction-to-Claim rate will be created such that, when multiplied together, they equal this rate.

derivedColumn.name: TransToReportingExchangeRateRate
derivedColumn.description: TransToReportingExchangeRate.Rate or null if TransToReportingExchangeRate is null

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

column.name: Valid
column.description: Indicates whether this BulkInvoice has been validated and if so whether the validation was successful.

derivedColumn.name: Validateable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this BulkInvoice can be validated (i.e., only if it has at least one BulkInvoiceItem and is not currently valid).

array.name: ValidationAlerts
array.description: Any alerts returned by the most recent validation call. If empty, then the BulkInvoice is considered valid.

derivedColumn.name: Voidable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this BulkInvoice can be voided (only if it's been submitted to the downstream system).

entity.description: Describes one item of the BulkInvoice, and corresponds to one line item of the original invoice. It contains data fields that define the reserve line to which the item is to be coded, as well as the amount and the PaymentType.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: Amount
column.description: The amount of this invoice item.

derivedColumn.name: AmountComponent
derivedColumn.description: Returns the amount and currency of this invoice item, as an IMoney. The currency is the owning invoice's currency.

derivedColumn.name: AssociatedPayment
derivedColumn.description: This is a convenience method to easily retrieve the single payment associated with this bulk invoice item, if any. If this bulk invoice item does not have an associated check/payment, then NULL will be returned

foreignKey.name: BulkInvoice
foreignKey.description: The bulk invoice that contains this bulk invoice item.

foreignKey.name: BulkInvoiceItemInfo
foreignKey.description: Links a BulkInvoiceItem to its info. Returns null if the associated Claim is Archived.

column.name: BulkInvoiceOrder
column.description: Order of the BulkInvoiceItem on the BulkInvoice.

derivedColumn.name: Claim
derivedColumn.description: The Claim for which this BulkInvoiceItem represents a payment.

foreignKey.name: ClaimInfo
foreignKey.description: The ClaimInfo for which this BulkInvoiceItem represents a payment.

column.name: ClaimNumber
column.description: Claim Number of the claim that this BulkInvoiceItem is related to.

typekey.name: CostCategory
typekey.description: The CostCategory of the payment associated with this item.

typekey.name: CostType
typekey.description: The CostType of the payment associated with this item.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

derivedColumn.name: Currency
derivedColumn.description: Gets the currency associated with the bulk invoice.

column.name: DateOfService
column.description: Date that the service was performed (if this check is for a service).

column.name: DeductionsAmount
column.description: The total amount of all deductions computed for the check associated with this bulk invoice item.

column.name: Description
column.description: A comment field for the invoice item. The contents of this field will be copied to the memo of the place-holder check that is created for this BulkInvoiceItem in ClaimCenter.

derivedColumn.name: Editable
derivedColumn.description:
Tests whether this BulkInvoiceItem is editable. It is editable if:

  • The status is one of:
    1. {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceItemStatus#TC_DRAFT}
    2. {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceItemStatus#TC_NOTVALID}
or
  • The status of the owning Bulk Invoice is {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceStatus#TC_AWAITINGSUBMISSION} and the status of this item is one of:
    1. {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceItemStatus#TC_APPROVED}
    2. {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.BulkInvoiceItemStatus#TC_REJECTED}
    3. {@link BulkInvoiceItemStatus#TC_INREVIEW}

column.name: Explanation
column.description: Validation warnings / errors generated for this BulkInvoiceItem during final processing.

derivedColumn.name: Exposure
derivedColumn.description: The Exposure, if any, for which this BulkInvoiceItem represents a payment.

derivedColumn.name: ItemClaimArchived
derivedColumn.description: True if this item's claim is archived. false if the Claim (ClaimInfo) has not been set yet, or the claim is not archived.

column.name: NonEroding
column.description: Indicates whether the associated payment should erode reserves (false) or not (true).

typekey.name: PaymentType
typekey.description: The PaymentType for the payment associated with this item.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: ReportingAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the amount of this invoice item in the reporting currency (default currency in 5.0.x).

derivedColumn.name: ReserveLine
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves the ReserveLine to which this BulkInvoiceItem is linked, if any.

derivedColumn.name: ReserveLineWrapper
derivedColumn.description: Reserve line wrapper on BulkInvoiceItemInfo

typekey.name: ReservingCurrency
typekey.description: The reserving currency of the payment associated with this item.

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.name: ServicePdEnd
column.description: End date of the service period for the check.

column.name: ServicePdStart
column.description: Start date of the service period for the check.

typekey.name: Status
typekey.description: The current business status of this item.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

entity.description: Encapsulates the search criteria for a Bulk Invoice search. The system does not store BulkInvoiceSearchCriteria entities; they only exist for a search and are discarded after use.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: ApprovedSum
derivedColumn.description: Runs a query that sums up the columns of the search result and returns the summed approved amount, as a CurrencyAmount object, for use in the SummaryRow on screen. This aggregation is done in the database, which is much faster than retrieving all the found invoices and adding up their amount values.

column.name: CheckNumber
column.description: Match by check number.

column.name: ClaimNumber
column.description: Match by claim number.

derivedColumn.name: CurrencyForLastSearch
derivedColumn.description: Gets the currency for the last search.

column.name: InvoiceNumber
column.description: Match by invoice number.

column.name: PayTo
column.description: Match by PayTo.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: ShowSumRow
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether the sum row should be displayed. This depends on whether the last performed search was done for a specific currency.

derivedColumn.name: ShowSumRowForLastSearch
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether the sum row should be displayed. Returns true if in single currency mode or the previous search was against a specific currency.

derivedColumn.name: SummaryRow
derivedColumn.description: Runs a query that sums up the columns of the search results, for use in the SummaryRow on screen. This is done in the database, which is faster than retrieving all the found bulk invoices and adding up their columns.

derivedColumn.name: TotalSum
derivedColumn.description: Runs a query that sums up the columns of the search result and returns the summed total amount, as a CurrencyAmount object, for use in the SummaryRow on screen. This aggregation is done in the database, which is much faster than retrieving all the found invoices and adding up their amount values.

entity.description: Aggregates the information needed to display a Bulk Invoice on the Bulk Invoice Search page.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: ApprovedCurrencyAmount
derivedColumn.description: ApprovedAmount property as a CurrencyAmount (to allow multicurrency display).

derivedColumn.name: New
derivedColumn.description: true if this bean is to be inserted into the database when the bundle is committed.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: TotalCurrencyAmount
derivedColumn.description: TotalAmount property as a CurrencyAmount (to allow multicurrency display).

entity.description: Represents a unit of work to process a bulk invoice item for submission. A work item has as its target a bulk invoice item for which a placeholder check needs to be created and submitted for approval, or marked as not valid if there are problems with it.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: AvailableSinceAsLong
derivedColumn.description: Return AvailableSince as Long value. May be null

column.name: Exception
column.description: Stack trace of the exception

derivedColumn.name: New
derivedColumn.description: true if this bean is to be inserted into the database when the bundle is committed.

derivedColumn.name: NumRetries
derivedColumn.description: Return that number of retries, i.e. Attempts - 1. Added for backward compatibility.

column.name: ProcessHistoryID

entity.description: A component used as part of a larger search criteria entity. Encapsulates the information entered by the user to restrict the search to particular contact, specified by some combination of name, tax ID and official ID. One CCNameCriteria entity will be used for each field that needs to be restricted. For example if a search criteria was being constructed to specify searches for an entity which had two different contact fields, then the search criteria would likely contain two distinct CCNameCriteria components. This ClaimCenter specific CCNameCriteria entity differs from the platform NameCriteria entity in that it is extendable and can be used with configurable search

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: CompanyName
column.description: The company name, if searching for a company.

column.name: FirstName
column.description: The first name, if searching for a person.

column.name: FirstNameKanji
column.description: First name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: LastName
column.description: The last name, if searching for a person.

column.name: LastNameKanji
column.description: Last name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: LicenseNumber
column.description:
License Number to search on.

Experimental. Do not use without consulting Guidewire.

column.name: Name
column.description: The last name or the first name.

column.name: NameKanji
column.description: This contact's name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: OfficialId
column.description: Field matched against the OfficialIDValue of the OfficialID objects associated with Contacts.

column.name: Phone
column.description:
Phone number to search on.

Experimental. Do not use without consulting Guidewire.

column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.description: True if any of the fields in this criteria object are set. False if no fields are set, so the criteria should not affect the search.

column.description: The contact's tax identification number.

entity.description: A paper Check or EFT issued to a particular payee to deliver one or more Payments. A Check can have multiple payees, in which case distinct Checks to each secondary payee are created in the same CheckSet, and they are all related to the primary check as members of a CheckGroup. For a single payee check, the check's amount is the aggregate of all the payments associated with it. For a multiple-payee check, each of the secondary checks gets a portion of the aggregated payments, and the remainder is the amount of the primary Check.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: AccountName
column.description: The name on the account

typekey.name: BankAccount
typekey.description: Source bank account.

column.name: BankAccountNumber
column.description: The bank account number

typekey.name: BankAccountType
typekey.description: The type of bank accout e.g. checking, savings etc

column.name: BankName
column.description: The name of the bank

column.name: BankRoutingNumber
column.description: The routing number is a nine digit bank code used in the United States

derivedColumn.name: Bulked

derivedColumn.name: BulkInvoiceItem
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves bulk invoice item associated with current check if any. If there is no associated bulk invoice item, returns null

foreignKey.name: BulkInvoiceItemInfo
foreignKey.description: If this check was created to act as a record-keeper for a bulk invoice item, this is the item it references.

derivedColumn.name: BulkInvoiceNumber
derivedColumn.description: Returns the invoice number of the BulkInvoice associated with the BulkInvoiceItem of this Check, or "<none>" if this Check is not bulked.

derivedColumn.name: BulletedListOfServiceRequestInvoicesForWarning
derivedColumn.description: Gets a string containing a bulleted list of invoices associated with this Service for use in warning messages for when a check operations will affect the invoices (e.g., {@link displaykey.Java.Financials.DeleteCheckWithInvoices.Tip.Payment}). Returns null if there aren't any invoices.

derivedColumn.description: Returns the order that a check occurs in a recurrence set based on its send date. If the check is not part of a recurrence set, then returns -1.

foreignKey.name: CheckRpt
foreignKey.description: The calculated data for this check.

foreignKey.name: CheckSet
foreignKey.description: CheckSet this Check belongs to.

foreignKey.name: CreateUser

derivedColumn.name: Currency
derivedColumn.description: The Currency of this check, and all its Payments. If this is a secondary check, the currency will be retrieved from the primary check

column.name: DateOfService

array.name: Deductions

derivedColumn.name: DeductionsClaimTotal
derivedColumn.description: Returns the sum of the claim amounts of all deductions on this check.

derivedColumn.name: DeductionsTotal
derivedColumn.description: Returns the sum of the transaction amounts of all deductions on this check.

derivedColumn.name: DeductionsTotalPair
derivedColumn.description: Gets the deductions total in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.

typekey.name: DeductionType
typekey.description: Deduction type for secondary checks. Always NULL for primary checks.

derivedColumn.name: Deletable
Deleteable
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether the check can be deleted.

typekey.name: DeliveryMethod
typekey.description: Requested delivery method.

derivedColumn.name: Editable

column.name: EnteredTime
column.description: The time the check was created. This is different from CreateTime, which is the time it was stored in the system.

derivedColumn.name: FirstPayee
derivedColumn.description: Get the first payee on the check (defined as Payees[0]). If no payees exist, then one will be created and added to the array.

derivedColumn.name: FirstPayment
derivedColumn.description:
Get a payment on the check. If no payments exist, then one will be created and added to the array.

Warning: The payment returned can change from one call to the next. Used where the Check is guaranteed to have only one payment, or to edit fields which will immediately be synchronized across all Payments, such as Currency and exchange rate. Use with caution.

derivedColumn.name: GrossAmount
derivedColumn.description: The gross amount of this check in the transaction currency. The amount is determined by summing the transaction amounts of all payments that belong to this check. Deductions are not accounted for.

derivedColumn.name: GrossAmountPair
derivedColumn.description: Gets the gross amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.

derivedColumn.name: GrossAmountSettableComponent
derivedColumn.description: Gets the Check GrossAmount. Sets the amount of the first Payment of the Check. Should only be edited when there is only one Payment on the Check, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

derivedColumn.name: GrossClaimAmount
derivedColumn.description: The gross amount of this check in the claim/default currency. The amount is determined by summing the claim amounts of all payments that belong to this check. Deductions are not accounted for.

derivedColumn.name: GrossReservingAmount
derivedColumn.description: The gross amount of this check in the reserving currency. The amount is determined by summing the reserving amounts of all payments that belong to this check. Deductions are not accounted for.

foreignKey.name: Group
foreignKey.description: CheckGroup this check belongs to, if it's part of a multi-payee check.

column.name: InvoiceNumber
column.description: Invoice number associated with the check.

column.name: IsPrimary
column.description: Indicates if this is the primary EFT record for the contact

column.name: IssueDate
column.description: Date the check was issued.

derivedColumn.name: LinkedToServiceRequests

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: MailTo
column.description: Name of the person/company to whom the check should be mailed.

column.name: MailToAddress
column.description: Address of the person/company to whom the check should be mailed.

derivedColumn.name: ManualCheck
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this check was manually entered.

column.name: Memo
column.description: Memo to include on the check.

derivedColumn.name: NetAmount
derivedColumn.description: The net transaction amount of this check. The amount is determined by subtracting any deductions from the gross check amount.

derivedColumn.name: NetAmountPair
derivedColumn.description: Gets the net amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.

derivedColumn.name: NetClaimAmount
derivedColumn.description: The net claim amount of this check. The amount is determined by subtracting any deductions from the gross check amount.

derivedColumn.description: Override the Transaction to Claim amount ExchangeRate for Payments on this Check. If true, {@link #getTransToClaimExchangeRateEntity()} returns a custom ExchangeRate entity with an editable Rate. If false, it returns the appropriate Market Exchange Rate (which is not editable).

derivedColumn.name: OverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate
derivedColumn.description: Returns whether the transaction-to-reserving exchange rate has been overridden for the payments on this check.

array.name: Payees
array.description: Recipients of the payment; there must be at least one. If there are multiple, each is a 'joint' payee.

typekey.name: PaymentMethod
typekey.description: Requested payment method for all payments in the check.

array.name: Payments

column.name: PayTo
column.description: Pay to the order of.

column.name: PendEscalationForBulk
column.description: Only escalate as part of a BulkInvoice.

column.name: PublicID

derivedColumn.description: Returns whether this check can be reissued; i.e., it belongs to a CheckGroup and either Check.Voidable or Check.Stoppable evaluate to true.

column.description: Reportable amount of the check in the transaction currency. Used by the BackupWithholdingCalculator as the amount of the check reportable to the IRS, from which it calculates backup withholding Deductions. It is editable in the UI.

derivedColumn.description: The ReportableAmount of the Check. This value is in the Check Currency.

derivedColumn.description: Tests if the check is a denied check that can be resubmitted as is

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.name: ScheduledSendDate
column.description: Date that the check is scheduled to be sent. Also used to determine if the check amount is included in Future Payments (tomorrow or later). Should only be modified in the UI or PreSetup rules.

derivedColumn.description: Get the only payment on the check; use where the check is expected to have 1 payment and any other state indicates a programming error. If the check does not have exactly 1 payment, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

typekey.description: Status of the check (issued, voided, cleared, and so on). Do not update directly. Use methods to initiate operations, or use updateCheckStatus() method.

derivedColumn.name: Stoppable
StoppableForReissue
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this check can be stopped and reissued. Note that this is a less strict test than isStoppable(), since it does not verify the status of other checks in the CheckGroup; because the check will be reissued, the payment associated with the CheckGroup will be left unchanged, so no check is necessary.

derivedColumn.name: Stopped
Transferable
Transferred

derivedColumn.description: The gross amount of this check before it was transferred.

derivedColumn.description: Gets the transferred amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the reserving currency.

derivedColumn.name: TransferredCheck
derivedColumn.description: If this check was created due to another check being transferred, this method returns the original check for which this is the transfer copy. If this check was not created in response to a transfer, then this method returns NULL.

derivedColumn.name: TransferredToCheck
derivedColumn.description: The Check that this check was transferred to.

derivedColumn.name: TransToClaimExchangeRateEntity
TransToClaimExchangeRateEntityRate
derivedColumn.description: The exchange rate in the ExchangeRate entity for TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount translation used for all Payments on this Check. See {@link #getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate()}. When in override mode, modify this property to change the exchange rate for the Check.

derivedColumn.name: TransToReservingExchangeRate

derivedColumn.name: Voidable
VoidableForReissue
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this check can be voided and reissued. Note that this is a less strict test than isVoidable(), since it does not verify the status of other checks in the CheckGroup; because the check will be reissued, the payment associated with the CheckGroup will be left unchanged, so no check is necessary.

derivedColumn.name: Voided

entity.description: Groups the Checks that are part of a multi-payee "check" (as it would be referred to by users). The primary Check of the CheckGroup (i.e., CheckGroup.PrimaryCheck) contains all of the Payments, and each secondary Check has a CheckPortion that indicates the portion of the total amount of the payments that it should receive. After amounts have been allocated to all secondary Checks according to the CheckPortions, the leftover amount is allocated to the primary Check.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

array.name: Checks
array.description: Check objects in the group, including the primary check. Together, these checks form a multi-payee check.

foreignKey.name: CheckSet
foreignKey.description: The TransactionSet that this check group belongs to.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

derivedColumn.name: DisplayableChecks
derivedColumn.description: The primary check and any secondary checks that have a CheckPortion defined.

derivedColumn.name: Editable
derivedColumn.description: True if all checks in this group are editable.

derivedColumn.name: GrossAmount
derivedColumn.description: The sum of all payments that belong to the checks of this check group.

derivedColumn.name: GrossAmountPair
derivedColumn.description: Gets the gross amount in the transaction currency paired with the amount in the claim currency.

column.name: LoadCommandID

derivedColumn.name: Checks
derivedColumn.description:
Gets all the Check entities for the given Claim. The system calculates this set by looking up the Check for every Payment on the Claim. When you are in a read-only context (i.e., none of the claim's checks are new/updated/removed and not yet committed to the database) use getChecksQuery() in rules instead. getChecksQuery returns a QueryProcessor from which you can get an Iterator. This is a far more efficient way to get all the checks for a claim.

Note: The beans returned by getChecks() are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Claim, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

derivedColumn.name: ChecksQuery
derivedColumn.description: Constructs a query to retrieve all the Checks for this claim. This is a much more efficient way to get the checks for this claim than using {@link #getChecks} when you are in a read-only context (i.e., none of the claim's checks are new/updated/removed and not yet commited to the database)

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

derivedColumn.name: ExposureListChangeable
derivedColumn.description: Can exposures be added to this claim? Claims with some loss types can have a variable number of exposures, while others always have a fixed set. For example in many systems Workers Compensation claims always have just one or two exposures and the end user cannot add or remove exposures once the claim has been created. This property reads a configuration parameter, ShowNewExposureMenuForLossTypes, and returns true if the loss type of the current claim is in that list. The result of this method is used to enable and disable various features in the UI - for example whether to show the new exposure menu, whether to show the claim exposure list page etc.

derivedColumn.description: The claim associated with this Claim/Exposure. For a Claim, just returns itself, for an exposure, returns the exposure's Claim.

derivedColumn.name: ISOClaimLevelMessaging
derivedColumn.description:
Should ISO ClaimSearch messages be sent at the claim level (as opposed to the exposure level) for this claim? The default implementation checks the following:
  1. Is claim level messaging enabled in the ISO properties file? If not then return false
  2. Has this claim already been sent to ISO (is its ISOSendDate non null)? If so then return true. This check is really an optimization so we don't have to check all the exposures for claims that have already been sent to ISO
  3. Have any exposures already been sent to ISO individually (that is, do any of them have a non null ISOSendDate). If so return false
  4. Otherwise return true
Customers can configure this property as necessary. For example they could choose to send messages at the claim level for particular loss types.

column.name: ISOEnabled
column.description: Is this field enabled for ISO.

derivedColumn.name: ISOErrorMessage
derivedColumn.description: Error message if most recent ISO ClaimSearch request failed. Otherwise null.

derivedColumn.name: ISOExposure
derivedColumn.description: If this is an exposure, returns itself, otherwise returns null

column.name: ISOKnown
column.description: Has a search request for this object been successfully received by ISO?

derivedColumn.name: ISOMatchReports
derivedColumn.description: Returns an array of the match reports associated with this Claim/Exposure, in random order

derivedColumn.name: ISOOrderedExposures
derivedColumn.description:
If ISO messages are sent at the claim level, this property is used to determine in which order the exposures on the claim will be processed when constructing an ISO ClaimSearch request. This can be important as there are some occasions when not all exposures can be added to the request, for example if more than one exposure would need a PropertyLossInfo aggregate, which can only appear once. In such situations a loss section will be added for the first exposure and the later one will be ignored.

The default implementation just orders by the ClaimOrder field on the exposures

derivedColumn.name: RelatedToCandidates
derivedColumn.description:
Gets an array of objects which can be set as the "related to" field for a note, document, activity, evaluation etc. The list contains, in order:
  1. The claim itself
  2. Any exposures that don't have claimants, ordered by order number
  3. All exposure claimants, ordered by name with each claimant followed by their exposures
  4. All specialist contacts, ordered by name with each specialist followed by their assigned service requests
  5. All matters on the claim, in display name order
  6. Any remaining contacts on the claim, in display name order 

[Claim] Entire Claim
[Contact] Bo Simpson
[Exposure] (1) Vehicle damage
[Contact] Ray Newton
[Exposure] (2) Bodily injury
[Exposure] (3) Lost wages
[Contact] Joe's Body Shop
[Service Request] - Repair - Joe's Body Shop
[Matter] Ray Newton matter
[Contact] Stan Newton

derivedColumn.description: Returns the list of contact objects for the users related to the claim: all users that are assigned to either the claim, its exposures, or any of its activities. Returns an empty array if the claim is new, since new claims and their activities/exposures haven't been assigned yet.

derivedColumn.description: Returns the list of users related to the claim: all users that are assigned to either the claim, its exposures, or any of its activities. Returns an empty array if the claim is new, since new claims and their activities/exposures haven't been assigned yet.

entity.description:
Represents a typed grouping of a set of claims. The relationship between Claim and ClaimAssociation is N-M; in other words, each Claim may be referenced by multiple ClaimAssociations, and each Claim Association references multiple Claims. In addition, the same two Claims may be joined by multiple associations. The type of each association is one of the values in the ClaimAssocType typelist.

In a Claim purge, an Association will only be purged if it has no remaining Claims in it.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

typekey.name: ClaimAssocType
typekey.description: Type of the association among the claims.

array.name: ClaimsInAssoc
array.description: The claims belonging to this association.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

column.name: Description
column.description: Description of the association.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.name: Title
column.description: A brief title for the association.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

entity.description:
Non-persistent set of criteria to use in searching for a specific {@link ClaimAssociation}. Several of the properties on this entity correspond to properties on the Claims included in the ClaimAssociations, rather than properties of the ClaimAssociations themselves.

Note that the search controlled by this search criteria entity cannot be customized through the search-config.xml mechanism, and that therefore extensions to this entity will have no effect on the performed search.

column.description: Internally managed primary key
