column.description: Number of a Claim included in the ClaimAssociation.

column.name: CompanyName
column.description: Company name of an insured of a Claim included in the ClaimAssociation.

column.name: FirstName
column.description: First name of an insured of a Claim included in the ClaimAssociation.

column.name: FirstNameKanji
column.description: First name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: LastName
column.description: Last name of an insured of a Claim included in the ClaimAssociation.

column.name: LastNameKanji
column.description: Last name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: LossDate
column.description: Loss date of a Claim included in the ClaimAssociation.

column.name: NameKanji
column.description: This contact's name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: Title
column.description: Desired ClaimAssociation title.

entity.description: Details of a match for a Claim returned by the Insurance Office Services (ISO) ClaimSearch service. If ISO ClaimSearch integration is enabled then descriptions of new or changed Claims are sent to the ISO ClaimSearch service to see if any suspiciously similar claims have been filed at other companies. If ISO ClaimSearch returns a "match report", indicating that one or more similar claims have been filed, then the report is added to the claim as a document and the most important information from each reported match is stored in an ISOMatchReport entity.

column.description: Internally managed primary key

entity.description: The stub of the claim that is left behind after the claim is archived. It contains minimal (summary) information about the claim; for example, claim number and loss location. It is also included in claim searches. Because this table is not archived, it has the potential to grow very large; care must be taken not to put too much data in it (for example, a blob) when extending it.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

array.description: The access control objects for this claim info.

foreignKey.description: Assigned user on Claim

column.description: When archiving was attempted on the root. Null if we never attempted to archive it.

foreignKey.description: Short version of the reason for a failure to archive

foreignKey.name: ArchiveFailureDetails
foreignKey.description: Full details of archive failure

foreignKey.name: ArchiveSchemaInfo
foreignKey.description: Schema version at which the root was archived or null if it was not archived

derivedColumn.name: ClaimCurrency
derivedColumn.description: Get the claim currency. For a live claim this will return the corresponding claim's currency. For an archived claim it will return the value in this info's Currency field. For claims archived in 8.0 or later this field will have been populated when the claim was archived. For earlier archived claims the field will be null, indicating that we don't know the currency of the archived claim.

array.name: ClaimInAssociations
array.description: All the ClaimInAssociation entities for the Claim.

column.name: ClaimNumber
column.description: The external identifier of the claim.

array.description: all the cached contacts (insured and claimant) for the archived claim

array.name: CoverageLineMatchData
array.description: Contains the coverage specifications for which at least one transaction exists on the archived claim. This is used to prevent future aggregate limits from being applied to coverage specifications where an archived claim's transaction would contribute, since it would no longer be possible to calculate the contribution of the archived claim.

column.name: CoverageLineMatchDataInfoValid
column.description: True for archived claims which have an accurate CoverageLineMatchDataInfo array, false otherwise

foreignKey.name: CreateUser

column.name: ExcludedFromArchive
column.description: Indicate if this entity should be excluded from archiving

column.name: ExcludeReason
column.description: Reason for excluding or skipping the entity from archiving. If the ExcludeFromArchive bit is set, this gives the reason for excluding. Else, if this is not null, it is the reason for skipping.

entity.description:
Represents the synchronization state of a Claim with respect to a particular MessageSink. As part of the work of integrating Guidewire application with other external and/or legacy systems, MessageSink objects are set up to receive messages and update those systems to reflect the new state of the Claim in the system.

Due to the asynchronous nature of messaging, those messages may not be transmitted immeditately, so the ClaimSynchState entity exists to track whether the external system represented by a particular MessageSink can be considered to be up-to-date with the system changes.

See {@link com.guidewire.pl.system.typelist.tl.SynchState} for the available synchronization states.

@see Claim#getClaimSynchStates

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

foreignKey.name: Claim
foreignKey.description: The Claim to which the synchronization state applies.

column.name: MessageSink
column.description: Identifies the message sink to which the synchronization state applies.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: SynchedToSystemOfRecord
derivedColumn.description:
Indicates whether or not the the claim is synched to the system of record. The system of record is determined by a setting on the Destination. A claim is synched if a message has been sent to the destination in response to a claim_valid event.
This supports the ability of ClaimCenter to display a read-only copy of claims assigned to a user who is not a ClaimCenter user. If the claim has been synched with a destination that is marked as a system of record, and the claim is assigned to an external user, the claim will be read-only in ClaimCenter. This allows ClaimCenter users to see the claim, but prevents edits that would be lost if the external user made changes to the claim in the SOR destination.

typekey.name: SynchState
typekey.description: The synchronization state of the given Claim with respect to the given message sink.

entity.description: Represents a generic contact like a person or a business. The Contact is a primary object in the ClaimCenter system that is used in the management of your company's vendors and the participants in a Claim. Contact is an abstract supertype with subtypes such as Person, Company, and Place. Guidewire provides an initial hierarchy of Contact types that you can extend. From a Contact entity you can reach the expected Contact data such as physical address, phone, and fax information. (In general, only the Primary Address is used for location-based functionality like Assignment and Geocoding/Proximity Search.) Contact and its subtypes can also contain management-related information such as social security number, tax ID, organization type , and so forth. Within ClaimCenter, users create Contacts that are associated only with a particular Claim. For example, an injured party is a typical claim contact. ClaimCenter does not attempt to determine if a contact associated with one claim appears elsewhere on another claim. Thus, any claim contact that users create, like an auto body shop, can be a duplicate of one or more other claim contacts associated with different claims. If ClaimCenter is integrated with Guidewire's ContactManager application, your users can create contacts and then access them centrally through the linking feature.Your company can have both centrally managed contacts, such as a vendor business, and locally managed contacts, such as an injured party. To support this behavior, ContactManager and ClaimCenter have matching hierarchies of Contact entities, which they can keep synchronized. So, for example, an extension made to a ClaimCenter Contact entity should also be made to a ContactManager ABContact entity. See the Contact Management Guide for more information about the integration between ClaimCenter and ContactManager.

derivedColumn.name: IsHighlyLinked
derivedColumn.description: Does this contact have enough links to be considered "highly linked"? If there are a total of more than "HighlyLinkedContactThreshold" contacts with the same address book UID as this contact (including this contact) then return true, otherwise return false. HighlyLinkedContactThreshold is a configuration parameter. This property only considers contacts that have been committed to the database, so it will ignore any newly inserted contacts in the current bundle that have the same address book UID. If the configurable threshold is set to zero this method will never return true.

entity.description:
Links Contact objects to other contacts. Each link has a specific relationship. See the ContactRel typelist for a list of the possible link relationships. The purpose of this table is to avoid a self-referencing foreign key on Contact, and to allow contacts to relate to one another in different ways.

For example, imagine a ContactContact entity with the following values:

  • SourceContactID: ID of Person A
  • Relationship: Employer
  • RelatedContactID: ID of Company B

Then the relationship between A and B is: Company B is the Employer of Person A.

column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.description: Represents the ID of the associated object in Address Book. Null if the object is not linked to Address Book.

foreignKey.description: "RelatedContactID" is the "Relationship" of "SourceContactID".

typekey.name: Relationship
typekey.description: Relationship between the two contacts.

foreignKey.name: SourceContact
foreignKey.description: "SourceContactID" has "RelatedContactID" as "Relationship".

entity.description: Represents a specification of relationships to retrieve/sync from the Address Book. The set of relationships to retrieve from the Address Book is specified in contact-sync-config.xml. Each of the contactBidiRel that is specified in <IncludeRelationship> in the contact-sync-config.xml is called "Syncable Relationship". A ContactRelationshipSpec contains two sets of syncable relationships, "SourceRelationships" and "TargetRelationships" which is grouped according to the contactBidiRel. This entity has been deprecated as of ClaimCenter 8.0 along with the IAddressBookAdapter plugin.

entity.description:
ContactSearchResult has been deprecated since ClaimCenter 8.0 along with IAddressBookAdapter.

Represents the set of results and additional information returned by an Address Book search. See the IAddressBookAdapter for information on searching for contacts.

derivedColumn.description: Gets the results. Length should not be greater than the maxResults setting in the corresponding RemotableSearchResultSpec. If there is at least one result, the first result should correspond to the startRow setting in the corresponding RemotableSearchResultSpec. Order should depend on the sort settings.

typekey.name: ResultType
typekey.description: Provides more detail about the result of the match.

typekey.name: SearchResultType
typekey.description: Indicates wheather the search succeeded of failed, and if failed, why.

column.name: TotalResults
column.description: Gets the total number of results. This will only be populated if the corresponding ContactSearchResultSpec has includeTotal = true.

entity.description: ContactUpdateResult has been deprecated as of ClaimCenter 8.0 along with IAddressBookAdapter.. ContactUpdateResult represents the result of creating or updating a Contact. This operation can either succeed or fail. If it failed, then errors will be accessible via getValidationResult. If it succeeded, then there should be no errors in the ValidationResult, and the created or updated Contact will be accessible via getContact.

foreignKey.description: Gets the Contact that was created or updated. Ignored if errors occurred.

foreignKey.name: ContactValidationResult
foreignKey.description: Used to report any errors that occurred during creation or update. May be null to report no errors.

entity.description: Maintains a user's system level-security identification. Each user has a corresponding Credential object. This entity maintains information related to authorization and authentication on the system. A Credential holds both the user's password and controls whether or not the user is active or not. This entity also tracks login attempts.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: Active
column.description: Whether this credential is active. Inactive credentials are not allowed to log in.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

column.name: FailedAttempts
column.description: The number of consecutive failed login attempts, or 0 if the last login attempt was successful.

column.name: FailedTime
column.description: The time the last failed login attempt was made, or null if the last login attempt was successful.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: LockDate
column.description: The time at which this credential was locked, or null if the credential is not locked. A user cannot log in if their credential was locked within the lockout interval, which is paramaterizeable.

derivedColumn.name: Locked
derivedColumn.description: Indicates whether or not this credential is considered locked. A user is locked out if their lock date is set and either the lock out period is -1 or the current time minus the lock date is less than the lock out period

column.name: Password
column.description: User password.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

column.description: User login name.

entity.description:
A component used as part of a larger search criteria entity. Encapsulates the information entered by the user to restrict the search to a particular date range. Specifies the date field to be restricted and allows the date range to be restricted either through a typelist of preset ranges (such as next 30 days) or through a start and end date.

Very similar to DateCriterionChoice, but DateCriterionChoice supports configurable search. (See the Configuration Guide for details of customizing search screens.)

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: CodeForDateRange
derivedColumn.description: The code for the "enteredrange" DateSearchType typekey.

derivedColumn.name: CodeForFromList
derivedColumn.description: The code for the "fromlist" DateSearchType typekey.

typekey.name: DateFieldToSearch
typekey.description: The date field which is being restricted. The available choices are filtered by the SearchType field.

derivedColumn.name: DateFieldToSearchList
derivedColumn.description: The list of available date fields to search, as filtered by the SearchType.

typekey.name: DateRangeChoice
typekey.description: The chosen preset date range, if any. The available ranges are filtered by the SearchType field. Used if DateSearchType is "fromlist".

derivedColumn.name: DateRangeChoiceList
derivedColumn.description: The list of available date range choices (preset date ranges), as filtered by the SearchType.

derivedColumn.name: DateRangeSearch
derivedColumn.description: True if DateSearchType is "enteredrange", false if it is "fromlist".

derivedColumn.name: DateRangeToSearch
derivedColumn.description: The date range to be search as specified either by the DateRangeChoice (if DateSearchType is "fromlist") or the StartDate and EndDate (if DateSearchType is "enteredrange").

typekey.name: DateSearchType
typekey.description: The type of date search, either "fromlist" (for a preset range) or "enteredrange" (for an explicitly entered range).

column.name: EndDate
column.description: The end (inclusive) of the date range to which the chosen date field should be restricted. Used if DateSearchType is "enteredrange".

derivedColumn.name: FromListSearch
derivedColumn.description: True if DateSearchType is "fromlist", false if it is "enteredrange".

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

typekey.name: SearchType
typekey.description: The type of search, filters the date fields allowed in the DateFieldToSearch field and the preset ranges allowed in the DateRangeChoice field.

derivedColumn.name: Set
derivedColumn.description: True if any of the fields in this criteria object are set. False if no fields are set, so the criteria should not affect the search.

column.name: StartDate
column.description: The start (inclusive) of the date range to which the chosen date field should be restricted. Used if DateSearchType is "enteredrange".

entity.description:
A component used as part of a larger search criteria entity. Encapsulates the information entered by the user to restrict the search to a particular date range. Specifies the date field to be restricted and allows the date range to be restricted either through a typelist of preset ranges (such as next 30 days) or through a start and end date.

Very similar to DateCriteria, but DateCriterionChoice supports configurable search. (See the Configuration Guide for details of customizing search screens.)

column.name: EndDate

column.name: StartDate
column.description: The start (inclusive) of the date range to which the chosen date field should be restricted. Used if DateSearchType is "enteredrange".

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionLineItem
derivedColumn.description:
Returns the single transaction line item for which this deductible is applied, if any, or null if none.
This property assumes that deductibles are only ever paid on a single TLI. It should not be used if deductibles can be paid across multiple TLIs (which does not occur OOB) and will throw an exception if it is in fact linked to multiple TLIs.

array.name: TransactionLineItems
array.description: The TransactionLineItems applied to this deductible.

column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

column.name: Waived
column.description: Specifies whether this deductible has been waived.

Attempts to call this method before wiring the deduction to a check and the check to a payment will result in an exception being thrown.

derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

entity.description:
Represents a physical or electronic document. This entity only contains information about the referenced document, known as metadata, not the actual document contents. Use IDocumentContentSource to retrieve and store document contents. Multiple Document entities may have the same value for the docUID field. This means simply that the Document entities represent the same physical document, for example, a document that applies to multiple claims.

Note that Document entities may or may not be stored in the database. You can implement a plugin interface, {@link com.guidewire.pl.plugin.document.IDocumentMetadataSource}, to retrieve document metadata from an external document management system (DMS). If you do not implement and register this interface, the system stores the Document entities in the database in the normal manner.

It is important to coordinate customizations of this entity with those of the DocumentSearchCriteria and DocumentSearchResult entities, so that users will be able to search for documents based on the most appropriate fields and select from the results.

The system retrieves the documents' contents (as referenced by Document entities) through the {@link com.guidewire.pl.plugin.document.IDocumentContentSource} plugin interface. This interface connects a Guidewire application to a DMS. The DMS property on the Document entity indicates whether the contents of the document are stored in the document management system; if not, then the entity merely denotes the existence of a physical document and no electronic access is available. If the contents do exist in the DMS, then the DocUID property must be a key that uniquely identifies the contents which should be displayed for a particular Document entity.

You can control access to particular Document entities through the SecurityType property. Use this property in conjunction with the security settings in security-config.xml. See the Administration Guide for more details.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: Author
column.description: Name of the person who created the document.

derivedColumn.name: CachedContentExists
derivedColumn.description: Returns the the cached status about whether the document content exists in the document content source. On the first call on the entity instance, it will call into document content source plugin to get the status and cache the result for future calls

foreignKey.name: Claim
foreignKey.description: Associated claim.

foreignKey.name: ClaimContact
foreignKey.description: Associated claim contact. Note that only one of Exposure, Matter, and ClaimContact may be set.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

column.name: DateCreated
column.description: Date and time the document was created.

column.name: DateModified
column.description: Date and time the document was last modified.

column.name: Description
column.description: Description of the document.

column.name: DMS
column.description: Whether this document has content stored in a Document Management System.

column.name: DocUID
column.description: The Unique Identifier (UID) for this document. The format of this UID is specific to the deployed Document Management System (DMS), and is passed to the configured IDocumentContentSource implementation.

column.name: DocumentIdentifier
column.description: Short human-readable identifier for the document, often used as an extra storage location for form codes, when name and documenttype are inadequate.

derivedColumn.name: DocumentLanguage
derivedColumn.description: Gets the language in which the document was created in. A null value means that it is not clear which language the document was created in. Most possibly, it is the default locale of the application.

foreignKey.name: Exposure
foreignKey.description: Associated exposure. Note that only one of Exposure, Matter, and ClaimContact may be set.

derivedColumn.name: Icon
derivedColumn.description: Returns the name of an icon image to represent this document. The result is based on the document's mime type.

column.name: Inbound
column.description: Whether the document is an inbound, outbound, or stationary (null) document

derivedColumn.name: IsServiceRequestStatementDocument
derivedColumn.description: Gets whether the document is linked to any Service Request Quote or Invoice

typekey.name: Language
typekey.description: The language in which this document is created.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

derivedColumn.name: Locale
derivedColumn.description: Gets the locale in which the document was created in. A null value means that it is not clear which language the document was created in. Most possibly, it is the default locale of the application.

foreignKey.name: Matter
foreignKey.description: Associated matter. Note that only one of Exposure, Matter, and ClaimContact may be set.

column.name: MimeType
column.description: The MIME type of this document; for example, application/msword for a Microsoft Word document.

column.name: Name
column.description: Human-readable name of the document.

column.name: Obsolete

entity.description:
Represents the criteria used in document searches. The criteria can include such things as the document name or ID, the documentauthor, the date, the related claim, exposure, matter, or claim contact, and similar items. ClaimCenter does not store this entity; it exists only for the search's duration.

If you configured a {@link com.guidewire.cc.plugin.document.IDocumentMetadataSource} implementation, then the system passes an instance of DocumentSearchCriteria to the searchDocuments method on that interface, and returns a {@link com.guidewire.cc.domain.document.DocumentSearchResult} instance any results for display in the UI.

If there is not an {@link com.guidewire.cc.plugin.document.IDocumentMetadataSource} interface configured, then any extensions fields included in the search criteria will also need to be configured through the search-config.xml file to be properly handled by the standard database query processing.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

foreignKey.name: Claim
foreignKey.description: Associated claim

foreignKey.name: ClaimContact
foreignKey.description: ClaimContact for RelatedTo search.

foreignKey.name: Exposure
foreignKey.description: Exposure for RelatedTo search.

foreignKey.name: Matter
foreignKey.description: Matter for RelatedTo search.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

foreignKey.name: ServiceRequest
foreignKey.description: ServiceRequest for RelatedTo search.

entity.description: Array of search results that match the specified criteria defined in {@link com.guidewire.cc.domain.document.DocumentSearchCriteria}.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Summaries
derivedColumn.description: Returns the Document search results encapsulated by this object.

column.name: TotalResults
column.description: Gets the total number of results. Should only be populated if the corresponding DocumentSearchResultSpec has includeTotal = true.

entity.description: Non-persistent entity used as wrapper for the list of document security types in the search criteria

entity.description:
Non-persistent set of criteria to use in searching for a specific document template. Document templates are used in conjunction with the {@link com.guidewire.cc.plugin.document.IDocumentProduction} plugin interface to create new documents contents and Document entities, and store them in a document management system.

Document template files are XML files whose format is defined in the deployed document-template.xsd file. Therefore additions of new document template descriptor properties which should be searchable must be coordinated between that xsd file, this entity, and the {@link com.guidewire.cc.domain.document.DocumentTemplateSearchResults} entity.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: effectivedate
column.description: The date and time to be used when filtering document templates by effective date.

column.name: Identifier
column.description: The required identifier value of the document templates.

column.name: Keywords
column.description: Comma-separated list of required keyword(s) set of the document template.

typekey.name: Language
typekey.description: The language in which the document is to be generated

typekey.name: Lob
typekey.description: The desired lob type of the document templates.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

typekey.name: Section
typekey.description: The desired section of the document templates.

typekey.name: State
typekey.description: The state (modeled as Jursidiction) to which the document template should apply. The Jurisdiction must be associated with JurisdictionType.TC_INSURANCE.

typekey.name: Type
typekey.description: Type of document created by the document template.

entity.description:
Non-persistent set of criteria to use to represent the results of a specific document template search. This entity should contain enough information to allow the user to select the desired document template.

Document template files are XML files whose format is defined in the deployed document-template.xsd file. Therefore additions of new document template descriptor properties which should be viewable on the results of a document template search must be coordinated between that xsd file, this entity, and the {@link com.guidewire.cc.domain.document.DocumentTemplateSearchCriteria} entity.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: DateEffective
column.description: The date/time on which the document template starts to be effective.

column.name: DateExpires
column.description: The date/time on which the document template expires.

column.name: DateModified
column.description: The last date/time the document template was modified.

column.name: Identifier
column.description: The identifier of the document template (distinct from the template ID).

typekey.name: Language
typekey.description: The language of the template

column.name: Lob
column.description: The lob type of the document template.

column.name: Name
column.description: The name of the document template.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: Section
column.description: The section to which the document template applies.

column.name: State
column.description: The state(s) to which the document template applies.

column.name: TemplateID
column.description: The ID of the document template.

typekey.name: Type
typekey.description: The type which will be assigned to documents created from this document template.

entity.description: Employment information for an exposure on a workers' comp claim.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: ClaimCurrency
derivedColumn.description:
Retrieves the currency of the claim that owns this EmploymentData object, or else the default currency if the claim is unreachable.

Note: The owning Claim is only found if this EmploymentData is referred to by one of the foreign keys pointing to it in the base configuration: Claim.EmploymentData, Exposure.NewEmpData, Exposure.PriorEmpData. Otherwise, it returns the default currency. This fallback is fine in single currency mode. In multiple currency mode implementations, if additional foreign keys to EmploymentData are added in extensions, this method must be modified to potentially find a path back to the Claim via those alternative owning entities.

foreignKey.name: ClassCode

column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.description: Returns all allowed contact roles for an exposure

foreignKey.name: AssignedQueue
foreignKey.description: Either the Queue to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the Queue to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

foreignKey.name: AssignedUser
foreignKey.description: Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeAndGroupDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing the current assignee plus their group, suitable for display to the user. This can be quite a long string, for example "Andy Applegate (Auto1 - TeamA)". See also {@link #getAssigneeDisplayString()} which omits the group name and may be more appropriate if space is tight.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing the current assignee, suitable for display to the user. See also {@link #getAssigneeAndGroupDisplayString()}, which returns a more detailed description of the assignee.

derivedColumn.name: ClaimantCoverageUnique
derivedColumn.description:
Returns a boolean flag indicating whether or not the claimant/coverage combination for this exposure is unique across all of this exposure's claim's exposures. NOTE: This method does NOT check the server parameter that indicates whether or not this restriction should be enforced at the UI level.

This method returns true if:

  • Claimant and/or coverage on this exposure are null
  • Claimant on the claim is null. This means the claim has no claimant at the claim level and no other exposure for this claim has the same claimant/coverage combination.
  • Claimant on the claim is the same as the claimant on the exposure, and the coverage is different than the coverages on all the other exposures on the claim.

Does not check the claim type before attempting to return the claim.ClaimantDenorm value.

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

entity.description: Details of a match for an Exposure returned by the Insurance Office Services (ISO) ClaimSearch service. If ISO ClaimSearch integration is enabled then descriptions of new or changed Exposures are sent to the ISO ClaimSearch service to see if any suspiciously similar claims have been filed at other companies. If ISO ClaimSearch returns a "match report", indicating that one or more similar claims have been filed, then the report is added to the claim as a document and the most important information from each reported match is stored in an ISOMatchReport entity.

entity.description:
Represents the synchronization state of an Exposure with respect to a particular MessageSink. As part of the work of integrating your Guidewire application with other external and/or legacy systems, MessageSink entities will be set up to receive messages and update those systems to reflect the new state of the Exposure in the system.

Due to the asynchronous nature of messaging, those messages may not be transmitted immeditately, so the ExposureSynchState entity exists to track whether the external system represented by a particular MessageSink can be considered to be up-to-date with the system changes.

See {@link com.guidewire.pl.system.typelist.tl.SynchState} for the available synchronization states.

@see Exposure#getExposureSynchStates

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

foreignKey.name: Exposure
foreignKey.description: The Exposure to which the synchronization state applies.

column.name: MessageSink
column.description: Identifies the message sink to which the synchronization state applies.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

typekey.name: SynchState
typekey.description: The synchronization state of the given Exposure with respect to the given message sink.

entity.description:
A component used as part of a larger search criteria entity. Encapsulates the information entered by the user to restrict the search to entities with a money field within a given range. Specifies the money field to be restricted and a range of allowable values.

Supports configurable search. (See the Configuration Guide for details of customizing search screens.).

column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: AmountEnd
column.description: The high end (inclusive) of the allowable range of money values.

column.name: AmountStart
column.description: The low end (inclusive) of the allowable range of money values.

column.name: ChosenOption
column.description: The chosen configurable search option, specifies the money field to be restricted.

derivedColumn.name: Options
derivedColumn.description: The list of options specifying which field to search. This list is populated by the configurable search mechanism. Each option is described by a display key name, as given in the search-config.xml file.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Set
derivedColumn.description: True if any of the fields in this criteria object are set. False if no fields are set, so the criteria should not affect the search.

typekey.name: Subtype
typekey.description: Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value

subtype.description: Special subclass of FinancialsCriterionChoice to be used for multicurrency-enabled searches

typekey.name: Currency
typekey.description: The currency to match for the search, if any. If no currency is chosen, and system is in multicurrency mode then the search will happen against claim currency amount

entity.description: A component used as part of a larger search criteria entity. Encapsulates the information entered by the user to restrict the search to particular group or to a particular group and its sub-groups. One GroupSearchCriterion entity will be used for each field that needs to be restricted. For example if a search criteria was being constructed to specify searches for an entity which had two different group fields, then the search criteria would probably contain two separate GroupSearchCriterion components.

entity.description: Represents a claim event. Each History entity represents a single claim-related event. The event may or may not have a related exposure or matter. A rule that results in a History event can provide a rule ID that is stored with the event. The set of History events related to an individual claim represent an event audit trail for that claim.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

foreignKey.description: Associated bulk invoice. Optional.

column.description: Description of the history event.

column.description: Timestamp when the event occurred.

foreignKey.name: Exposure
foreignKey.description: Associated exposure. Optional.

derivedColumn.description: Returns the first Payment on this history event's checkset's primary check, or throws a DisplayableException if no such payment exists.

derivedColumn.name: FirstTransaction
derivedColumn.description: Returns the first Transaction on this history event, or throws a DisplayableException if there are no transactions.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: PublicID

foreignKey.description: Associated transaction set. Optional.

typekey.name: Type
typekey.description: Type of claim or exposure event.

foreignKey.name: User
foreignKey.description: User who created this history event. Optional.

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

entity.description: An active message created by the event fired rules in response to an event in the ClaimCenter system. A message is intended for a particular destination that can be determined by getDestinationID. Messages carry a payload containing the data to be sent to the destination. Messages are dispatched using a MessageTransport plugin specified in config.xml, which is responsible for sending the message to the receiving system. See the ClaimCenter Integration documentation for more details about the lifecycle of Messages.

This should not be confused with Message.putEntityByName() and Message.getEntityByName() which allow entities to be attached to the message for lookup at send and reply time.

entity.description: MetroReport entity corresponds to the report obtained from Metropolitan Reporting Bureau. MetroReport contains some required data fields for requesting or receiving message from Metropolitan Reporting Bureau (such as loss description, sent date and status). It also has a reference to the generated document. A MetroReport is associated with a single claim.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: AgentCity
column.description: City of investigating agency

column.name: AgentName
column.description: Name of Investigating Agency that issued the report

derivedColumn.name: Document
derivedColumn.description: Return the report document attached to this Metro report or null if there is no such document. This property should be used in preference to the "Doc" property because it works even if a custom IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is used to store the document metadata. The Doc property only works if the document metadata is stored directly in the database

column.name: DocumentURL
column.description: The URL link to the document provided by Metro

column.name: ErrorMessage

column.name: ForceDuplicate

derivedColumn.description: Return true if the workflow has been started for this report and it has been running longer than the "Order Timeout". If the workflow has passed the order timeout and has not yet had a successful reply to the initial order request then it will finish and generate an error activity

derivedColumn.name: PastWorkflowTimeout
derivedColumn.description: Return true if the workflow has been started for this report and it has been running longer than the "Workflow Timeout". If the workflow has passed the workflow timeout and has not yet had a successful reply to the initial workflow request then it will finish and generate an error activity

column.name: Precinct

column.name: ReceivedDate

entity.description: A component used as part of a larger search criteria entity. Encapsulates the information entered by the user to restrict the search to particular contact, specified by some combination of name, tax ID and official ID. One NameCriteria entity will be used for each field that needs to be restricted. For example if a search criteria was being constructed to specify searches for an entity which had two different contact fields, then the search criteria would likely contain two distinct NameCriteria components.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: CompanyName
column.description: The company name, if searching for a company.

column.name: CompanyNameKanji
column.description: The company name, if searching for a company, in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: FirstName
column.description: The first name, if searching for a person.

column.name: FirstNameKanji
column.description: The first name, if searching for a person, in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: LastName
column.description: The last name, if searching for a person.

column.name: LastNameKanji
column.description: The last name, if searching for a person, in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: Name
column.description: The last name or the first name.

column.name: NameKanji
column.description: The last name or the first name in kanji. Used only for Japanese names and will be null otherwise.

column.name: OfficialId
column.description: Field matched against the OfficialIDValue of the OfficialID objects associated with Contacts.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: Set
derivedColumn.description: True if any of the fields in this criteria object are set. False if no fields are set, so the criteria should not affect the search.

column.name: TaxId
column.description: The contact's tax identification number.

derivedColumn.description: Tests whether the sum row should be displayed. Returns true if in single currency mode or the previous search was against a specific currency.

derivedColumn.name: Sum
derivedColumn.description: Runs a query that sums up the columns of the search result and returns the summed amount, as a CurrencyAmount object, for use in the SummaryRow on screen. This aggregation is done in the database, which is much faster than retrieving all the found checks and adding up their amount values.

derivedColumn.name: SummaryRow
derivedColumn.description: Runs a query that sums up the columns of the search results, for use in the SummaryRow on screen. This is done in the database, which is faster than retrieving all the found Checks and adding up their columns.

entity.description: Describes an insurance policy against which a claim has been filed. When a claim is entered in the system, the policy search adapter retrieves the policy information from an external system, stores it as a unique Policy, and associates it to the claim. There is a one-to-one relationship between claims and policies in the system. If multiple claims have been filed against the same actual policy, there will be a distinct Policy for every Claim in the system.

derivedColumn.name: PrimaryLocation
derivedColumn.description:
Returns the "primary location" on the policy, if any. The rules are a little complex, but can be configured if necessary, by changing the logic in this property:
  • The policy locations are sorted by location number
  • If a location has the PrimaryLocation bit set then that location is returned. If multiple locations have the bit set then the one with the lowest location number is used
  • If no location has the PrimaryLocation bit set then the first location (as ordered by location number) is returned
Most homeowners policies will just have a single PolicyLocation in any case. Note that location numbers are strings so the sorting is alphanumeric, not numeric.

derivedColumn.name: PrimaryLocationCoverages
derivedColumn.description: Returns the property coverages on the primary location. First finds the primary location by calling the PrimaryLocation property then, if it is non null, looks for LocationBasedRU risk units which reference that location. The coverages are taken from the first risk unit in that list (as ordered by risk unit number). Typically homeowners policies will have just a single risk unit. If the PrimaryLocation is null or there are no matching risk units, returns an empty array

entity.description: Represents the period during which an insurance policy provides coverage. Every claim entered into ClaimCenter is associated with a unique policy entity, even if it shares the same real-world policy with multiple claims. A policy entity is essentially a "snapshot" of the real-world policy at the time the claim was entered into ClaimCenter. The PolicyPeriod entity groups these separate, but related, policy entities together for the purpose of determining the amount of an aggregate limit or deductible that has been used by the associated claims.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: AccountNumber
column.description: Account number that the policies of this PolicyPeriod belong to.

array.name: AggregateLimitRpts
array.description: Denormalized data for this period.

array.name: AggregateLimits
array.description: Aggregate limits for the policies in this period.

array.name: ClaimAggregateLimitRpts
array.description: Denormalized data for this period per claim.

array.name: CoverageLines
array.description: Coverage lines associated with this period.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

column.description: Date on which the policy is effective.

column.name: ExpirationDate
column.description: Date on which the policy expires.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

array.name: Policies
array.description: Policies that belong to this period.

column.name: PolicyNumber
column.description: Number of the policy (generally a string).

typekey.description: Type of policy period: account or policy.

column.name: PolicySuffix
column.description: Indicates each unique period that a policy has been in effect. (Sometimes called 'Mod' or 'Module.')

typekey.name: PolicyType
typekey.description: Type of policy to which this period applies.

entity.description:
Results of a policy retrieval. The possible outcomes of a policy retrieval are:
  • Successful - Retrieval parameters map to a single, unique policy.
  • Unsuccessful - Retrieval parameters don't map to any policies.
  • Unsuccessful - Retrieval parameters map to multiple policies.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: NotUnique
column.description: True if the retrieval parameters map to multiple policies; false otherwise.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

foreignKey.name: Result
foreignKey.description: Detailed information about the policy. This is valid only if exactly one policy is retrieved. If zero or multiple policies match the retrieval parameters, then this is null.

entity.description:
Encapsulates the set of additional criteria needed to perform a proximity search. This entity is a child object to the ContactSearchCriteria entity.

Note that there are two ways to specify the origin location for a proximity search: the Geocode fields on the ProximitySearchParameters itself (SpatialPoint/GeocodeStatus) or the ConstactSearchCriteria.ProximitySearchCenter field. If both are set prior to performing the search, the system will use Geocode fields and ignore the ProximitySearchCenter field.

See ContactSearchCriteria for more information

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: CorrectedSearchCenter
column.description: The corrected address (if any) corresponding to the SpatialPoint of that is being searched for, in localized/user-displayable form. This is normally set by the ProximitySearchPageHelper.

column.name: DistanceBasedSearch
column.description: Indicates whether this is a distance based search (within n-mi/km) or an ordinal search (nearest-n)

typekey.name: GeocodeStatus
typekey.description: Gives the status of the provided SpatialPoint; this is normally copied from the a Geocodable entity.

derivedColumn.name: Label
derivedColumn.description: Returns a localized, human-readable string for indicated search, such as "10 miles" or "5 closest".

column.name: Number
column.description: Indicates either the radius (in UnitOfDistance units) if a distance based search, or the number of results to return if an ordinal search.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: RadiusSearchMaxResults
column.description: Indicates the maximum number of items to return on a radius search. Ignored if DistanceBasedSearch is false; if DistanceBasedSearch is true, and this value is null, zero, or negative, the search will be limited by the value of ProximityRadiusSearchDefaultMaxResultCount

column.name: SavedSearchCenter
column.description: Used internally by ProximitySearchPageHelper to save the search center address (if any) in standardized form; DO NOT USE unless you are overriding the standard performProximitySearch() method.

derivedColumn.name: SearchValid
derivedColumn.description: Checks if fields are populated indicating that a proximity search is intended. Note that this does not

column.name: SpatialPoint
column.description: SpatialPoint to do a proximity search from; this is normally copied from the a Geocodable entity.

typekey.name: UnitOfDistance
typekey.description: Indicates the UnitOfDistance to use, both to return distances in results and to indicate the unit of radius for distance-based searches.

derivedColumn.name: UnitsString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a localized, human-readable string for the type of search, either the Unit of Distance or a localized string indicating "closest."

entity.description: RITAccounts are used in ClaimCenter to provide a rolled-up view of all Reinsurance (RI) financials transactions entered into the system. They share the same functionality as TAccounts for regular transactions. Each RICoding (unique combination of ReserveLine and RIAgreement) has X distinct TAccounts that together represent every possible life cycle state for each of the 2 RI transaction subtypes (Ceded Reserves, Payment Recoverables), and distinguish the totals for normal transactions vs. "adjustment" transactions. Although RITransaction only use the Submitting/Submitted status, we use the same TAccount mechanism as regular transactions so Financials Calculations and other code can be reused.

entity.description: Contains the TAccountLineItems that change a pair of T-accounts to account for a transaction as it moves through its LifeCycle States. For example, when a reserve becomes committed, it is debited (removed from) Pending Approval ReservesXX T-Account and added (credited) to the ReservesXX T-Account. Each TAccountTransaction has a link to its succeeding TAccountTransaction, thus providing a history of the life of the associated transaction.

subtype.description: A subtype of RITransaction that indicates an Amount of Reserves attributable to a particular RIAgreement. In other words, we have created Reserves, and if we pay out all that money, the reinsurer behind the RIAgreement will be obligated to reimburse us for this amount according to the RI treaty. It is a heads up about potential reinsurer liability. Like both types of RITransactions, RICededReserves behave similar to Reserve transactions as entities: they are immutable, and so multiple positive or negative transactions are created to adjust the total on a particular RICoding. To get the Total Ceded Reserves and other RI financials calculations, use the FinancialsCalculationUtil class.

A subtype of RITransaction that indicates an Amount of Payments attributable to a particular RIAgreement. Money has been paid out, so the reinsurer behind the RIAgreement is obligated to reimburse us for this amount according to the RI treaty. Like both types of RITransactions, RIRecoverables behave similar to Reserve transactions as entities: they are immutable, and so multiple positive or negative transactions are created to adjust the total on a particular RICoding. To get the Total RI Recoverables and other RI financials calculations, use the FinancialsCalculationUtil class.

entity.description:
A combination of Claim, Exposure, CostType, and CostCategory, used to categorize every Transaction on a claim. Every Transaction has a ReserveLine. Claim is required, as all Transactions must be associated with a Claim. Exposure can be NULL, in which case the Transaction and ReserveLine are "Claim-level". CostType and CostCategory are typelists that contain values for categorizing Transactions, which can be configured for the customer's needs. CostType and CostCategory cannot be NULL, but each has an Unspecified value (which may be removed during configuration).

Every Transaction either increases or depletes reserves on a ReserveLine. Given the flexibility of Exposure being null, and the two typelists being configurable, customers can track their Transactions according to their needs: all Reserves and Payments could occur at the claim-level, or they could be categorized by exposure, CostType ("ClaimCost", "A & O" adjusting expenses, etc) and CostCategory (Auto body repair, Legal, Vehicle Inspection, etc). Only certain combinations of Exposure coverage type, CostType, and CostCategory are valid, as defined in the CostCategory.xml typelist file.

column.description: Internally managed primary key

foreignKey.description: The related claim.

typekey.description: The costcategory for this transaction.

typekey.name: CostType
typekey.description: Type of cost (for example, LAE or claim cost).

column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

foreignKey.name: Exposure
foreignKey.description: The related exposure.

entity.description: Provides a level of indirection between a BulkInvoiceItem and its ReserveLine. This is necessary when a BulkInvoiceItem is created for a non-existent reserve line, and so cannot be committed to the database. The BulkInvoiceItem has a non-null foreign key (FK) to ReserveLineWrapper, with a second FK from the wrapper to the actual reserve line that is null if the reserve line doesn't yet exist. The Bulk Invoice screen displays the wrapper's correct but uncreated reserve line so the user never knows if the displayed reserve line exists yet.

entity.description:
Base class use for the results of plugin search methods. The result encapsulates a Boolean value indicating if results were capped, and optionally the total number of matches that would have been returned had the results not been capped. The total number of matches is relevant only when the capped Boolean value is true.

This base class is of little interest on its own but provides basic functionality that may be useful for application specific subclasses.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: ResultsCapped
column.description: Returns true if and only if the results of the search have been capped, that is, if fewer results are contained in this result than actually satisfied the search criteria.

typekey.name: Subtype
typekey.description: Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value

column.name: UncappedResultCount
column.description: Returns the total number of matches that would have been returned had the results not been capped, or null if the value is unknown. The result of this method is relevant only if ResultsCapped returns true.

subtype.description: Results of an external contact search ( IContactSearchAdapter.searchContacts()) containing a set of contact summary objects. Not all resulting contacts may be returned. If the matching results exceeds the maximum number of result rows, then only the system returns only the first n contact summary objects. See IContactSearchAdapter for details about external searches.

derivedColumn.name: Results
derivedColumn.description: Set of contact summaries returned from the search. If no results match the search criteria, then this is empty (not null).

subtype.description: Non-persistent result object returned by the policy admin adapter's searchPolicies() method. The result encapsulates an array of PolicySummary objects, as well as the fields in indicating whether or not the search results were capped and, if so, how many total results would have been returned had the results not been capped.

entity.description: Used to partition groups, users and entities assigned to them. By default, a user in one zone cannot view an entity assigned to someone in a different zone. Each group belongs to exactly one security zone, and a customer can define an arbitrary number of security zones. A user is a member of a zone if they are a member of a group in the zone, and an assignable entity belongs to a zone if its assigned group belongs to the zone. For full details see the Administration Guide.

derivedColumn.name: ActiveChecksAmount
derivedColumn.description:
Returns the sum of the amounts of the checks linked to this service request that are in one of the following "active" states:
  • Pending approval
  • Awaiting submission
  • Requesting
  • Requested
  • Notifying
  • Issued
  • Cleared
This list of states is intended to include checks that are likely to be successfully sent.

derivedColumn.name: CurrentAssignment
derivedColumn.description:
This method exists to support the notion of "secondary" assignment in the Assignment Rules. "Secondary" assignments generally represented by UserRoleAssignment entities, are assignments of "roles" to users, separated from the single "primary" owner of the entity.

It is generally desirable for Assignment rule writers to be able to re-use a single set of, say, Claim Assignment rules for both primary and secondary assignments. This method allows rules to be written in the form of Claim.CurrentAssignment.assignXXX() rather than Claim.assignXXX(). If the primary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the entity itself (in this case, the Claim). If a secondary assignment is being performed, then getCurrentAssignment() will return the UserRoleAssignment which is current being operated upon.

Obviously, if an entity does not support secondary assignment (i.e. does not implement the UserRoleOwner interface), then rules do not need to use this method. Secondary assignments done outside of the Assignment Rules can simplay call the assignXXX methods directly on the UserRoleAssignment entity themselves, and therefore also do not require this method.

Since this method is dependent on the Assignment Engine state, calling it outside of the Assignment Rules is illegal.

derivedColumn.description: Gets whether this Service Request is the result of promoting another Service Request

typekey.description: The kind for this service request.

derivedColumn.name: LatestChange
derivedColumn.description: Gets the ServiceRequestChange recording the last change made to the ServiceRequest.

column.name: LatestChangeTimestampDenorm
column.description: The timestamp of the latest ServiceRequestChange in the History. This value is denormalized here for ease of ordering ServiceRequests in queries. This is non-nullable because History cannot be empty.

foreignKey.name: LatestQuote
foreignKey.description: The latest quote associated with this service request. It is null if no quote has been added to the service request

array.name: Messages
array.description: Messages related to this service request

array.name: Notes
array.description: The notes associated with this service request

derivedColumn.name: NotesWithPermCheck
derivedColumn.description: Gets the notes that are viewable by the current user, based on their permissions

derivedColumn.name: OrderedHistory
derivedColumn.description: Gets the history of ServiceRequestChanges, ordered by ServiceRequestChange.Sequence, ascending.

foreignKey.name: OriginatingServiceRequest
foreignKey.description: The originating quote-only service request for this service request. Note: This will be non-null only when a quote-only service request is promoted to a quote and service service request.

derivedColumn.name: OutstandingInvoicesAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the sum of the amounts of the invoices on this Service Request that have been approved but have not been paid, rejected, or withdrawn

derivedColumn.name: PassedWaitingThreshold
derivedColumn.description: Gets whether this service request has been in "specialist waiting" state for more than a global threshold.

foreignKey.name: PreviousGroup
foreignKey.description: Group to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: PreviousQueue
foreignKey.description: Queue to which this entity was previously assigned.

foreignKey.name: PreviousUser
foreignKey.description: User to which this entity was previously assigned.

typekey.name: Progress
typekey.description: This service request's current place in its life cycle.

derivedColumn.name: PromotionServiceRequest
derivedColumn.description: Gets the Service Request that was created as a result of a promotion for this Service Request

derivedColumn.name: PromotionServiceRequests
derivedColumn.description: Gets the Service Requests for which OriginatingServiceRequest is equal to this ServiceRequest

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

derivedColumn.name: QuoteLabel
derivedColumn.description: Gets the label for the quote details based on the quote state in the Service Request

array.name: Quotes
array.description: The Quotes associated with this service request

typekey.name: QuoteStatus
typekey.description: The current quote status for this service request.

derivedColumn.name: RejectedAndWithdrawnInvoicesAmount
derivedColumn.description: Gets the total amount of all the invoices in this Service Request that are in states 'rejected' or 'withdrawn'

column.name: RequestedQuoteCompletionDate
column.description: Desired date by which the specialist will have submitted the quote, or null if the specialist has not indicated such a date.

column.name: RequestedServiceCompletionDate
column.description: Desired date by which the specialist will have completed the work, or null if the specialist has not indicated such a date.

array.name: ServiceRequestMetrics
array.description: Metrics related to this service request

column.name: ServiceRequestNumber
column.description: A globally-unique, user-readable identifier for this service request. This number is normally generated within ClaimCenter.

column.name: ServiceRequestReferenceNumber
column.description: A string identifier assigned to this ServiceRequest by the specialist. The value of this field may only be meaningful to the specialist.

derivedColumn.name: ServicesString
derivedColumn.description: Gets a string representing the services to be performed for this service request, formatted as "ParentServiceType - MostSpecificServiceType"

derivedColumn.name: ShortDisplayName
derivedColumn.description: Gets the short display name for the ServiceRequest defined in the entity name

foreignKey.name: Specialist
foreignKey.description: The vendor or internal entity selected to do the work requested by this service request.

typekey.name: SpecialistCommMethod
typekey.description: The channel through which the carrier will communicate with the specialist.

derivedColumn.name: SpecialistName
derivedColumn.description: Gets the specialist's display name or a displaykey indicating no specialist is assigned

derivedColumn.name: StatusIcon
derivedColumn.description: Gets the status icon for this Service Request

derivedColumn.name: SuggestedAssignees
derivedColumn.description: Returns the suggested assignees for this entity, to be displayed in the UI as the most likely assignees when the user is assigning the entity. The list of assignees will depend on the type of entity, and will contain users who are somehow "involved" with the entity, associated claim, or currently assigned user and group.

derivedColumn.name: TerminalProgressValues
derivedColumn.description: Returns whether this ServiceRequest has reached a terminal state

derivedColumn.name: Terminated
derivedColumn.description: Returns whether this ServiceRequest has reached a terminal progres value

typekey.name: Tier
typekey.description: The tier of this service request.

derivedColumn.name: TypePrefixedIncidentName
derivedColumn.description: Gets the incident's type prefixed name or a displaykey indicating the service request is at claim level

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

derivedColumn.name: ValidationResult
derivedColumn.description: Gets the validation result.

derivedColumn.name: ViewableDocumentLinksAndDocuments
derivedColumn.description: Returns a list of pairs of document links and documents for this service request where the user has permission to view the document.

entity.description: An instance of this type records a change to its service request. Properties with names following the "New_" and "_Chg" naming conventions are populated automatically by ServiceRequest.recordChange.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

column.name: Description
column.description: An optional explanation for this change.

column.name: ExpectedQuoteCompletionDate_Chg
column.description: True if ExpectedQuoteCompletionDate is changing.

column.name: ExpectedServiceCompletionDate_Chg
column.description: True if ExpectedServiceCompletionDate is changing.

foreignKey.name: Initiator
foreignKey.description: The user who initiated this change.

column.name: Instruction_Chg
column.description: True if Instruction is changing.

column.name: New_ExpectedQuoteCompletionDate
column.description: The new value of ServiceRequest.ExpectedQuoteCompletionDate, or null if ExpectedQuoteCompletionDate did not change.

column.name: New_ExpectedServiceCompletionDate
column.description: The new value of ServiceRequest.ExpectedServiceCompletionDate, or null if ExpectedServiceCompletionDate did not change.

foreignKey.name: New_Instruction
foreignKey.description: The new value of ServiceRequest.Instruction, or null if Instruction did not change. Note that it is expected that ServiceRequest.Instruction will only start referring to a particular instruction once -- there should be at most one ServiceRequestChange on a ServiceRequest referring to a particular ServiceRequestInstruction with this foreign key.

typekey.name: New_Progress
typekey.description: The new value of ServiceRequest.Progress, or null if Progress did not change.

typekey.name: New_QuoteStatus
typekey.description: The new value of ServiceRequest.QuoteStatus, or null if Quote Status did not change.

typekey.name: Operation
typekey.description: The operation performed during this change

column.name: Progress_Chg
column.description: True if Progress is changing.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: QuoteStatus_Chg
column.description: True if Quote Status is changing.

foreignKey.name: RelatedStatement
foreignKey.description: The service request statement that is related to this change.

column.name: Sequence
column.description: The sequence of this change on the ServiceRequest. ServiceRequestChanges are ordered consecutively starting with Sequence of 1.

foreignKey.name: ServiceRequest
foreignKey.description: The related service request.

column.name: Timestamp
column.description: The time at which this change was applied. This timestamp is stored for informational purposes, but it may be possible for the relative timestamps of two instances to incorrectly or ambiguously indicate the relative order of two instances. For reliable ordering, use the Sequence property instead.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

entity.description: Associates a Service Request to a Document. Use ServiceRequest.linkDocument and unlinkDocument to create links between ServiceRequests and documents.

column.name: DateSpecialistNotified
column.description: The date that the specialist was notified about the linked document, or null if the specialist has not been notified.

foreignKey.name: Document
foreignKey.description: Associated Document. Warning: even though there is always a Document associated with this entity, this field may be null when the IDocumentMetadataSource plugin is enabled. To reliably get the associated Document, use the LinkedDocument property.

derivedColumn.name: DOCUMENT_TO_VENDOR_ADDED_EVENT
derivedColumn.description: Name of the add to vendor document event

derivedColumn.name: LinkedDocument
derivedColumn.description: Find the document linked to a ServiceRequestDocumentLink, or null if the current user does not have permission to view the document. If plugin enabled, gets the document from the plugin, falling back on the DB in case the linkage between ServiceRequestDocumentLink and document has not been saved to the plugin yet. Otherwise, gets the document from the DB.

column.description: Whether this document should be visible to the specialist.

entity.description: TAccounts are used in ClaimCenter to provide a rolled-up view of all financials transactions entered into the system. Each Reserve Line (unique combination of Claim, Exposure, Cost Type and Cost Category) has 22 distinct TAccounts that together represent every possible life cycle state for each of the four transaction subtypes (Payment, Reserve, Recovery and Recovery Reserve). The Taccounts occur in pairs; a debit account (example: ReservesXX, which holds the amount of a reserve) and a matching credit account (example: Cash Out). Every life cycle state transition for a transaction (e.g., from pending-approval to awaiting-submission) affects one debit and one credit T-account equally (example: a payment debits ReservesXX and credits Cash Out). ClaimCenter provides useful calculated values by combining the balances of various TAccounts as appropriate.

column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

entity.description: Contains the TAccountLineItems that change a pair of T-accounts to account for a transaction as it moves through its LifeCycle States. For example, when a reserve becomes committed, it is debited (removed from) Pending Approval ReservesXX T-Account and added (credited) to the ReservesXX T-Account. Each TAccountTransaction has a link to its succeeding TAccountTransaction, thus providing a history of the life of the associated transaction.

column.description: Comments about the transaction, such as the LifeCycleState transition for which it was created.
