entity.description:
Represents a financial operation, such as creating a reserve or scheduling a payment. It is an abstract supertype, and the UI uses only its four subtypes:
  • Reserve - expected payments
  • Payment - money paid out or liability incurred
  • RecoveryReserve - expected recoveries
  • Recovery - credit or money received

Every transaction is made against a single ReserveLine. It contains a non-null array of TransactionLineItem entities holding the amount(s) of the transaction. Checks are not transactions. A single transaction will affect multiple T-accounts.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: Amount
derivedColumn.description: Equivalent to TransactionAmount. Provided for backwards compatibility on SINGLE currency mode servers.

foreignKey.name: Claim
foreignKey.description:
The related claim.

Setting the claim also sets this transaction's currency to the claim's currency if it is null.

derivedColumn.name: ClaimAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the Claim amount of this transaction, which is the equivalent of transaction amount in the claim currency. The amount is determined by summing the claim amounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

foreignKey.name: ClaimToReportingExchangeRate
foreignKey.description: ExchangeRate to use when converting ClaimAmount to ReportingAmount. Setting this value updates the reporting amounts.

column.name: Comments
column.description: Comments about the transaction, such as a reason.

typekey.name: CostCategory
typekey.description: The CostCategory for this transaction.

typekey.name: CostType
typekey.description: Type of cost (for example, claim cost or adjusting overhead).

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

typekey.name: Currency
typekey.description: The Currency of the transaction amount.

derivedColumn.name: Deletable
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if this Transaction can be deleted. For Payments, Check.Deleteable should normally be used instead, since, after a Check has been created, its Payments cannot be deleted individually--the entire Check must be deleted.

derivedColumn.name: Deleteable
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if this Transaction can be deleted. For Payments, Check.Deleteable should normally be used instead, since, after a Check has been created, its Payments cannot be deleted individually--the entire Check must be deleted.

derivedColumn.name: DetailPageTitle
derivedColumn.description: Returns the title to use for the detail page that displays detail of is transaction - different transaction types use different titles, such as "Payment Details", "Recovery Details" and so on.

derivedColumn.name: Editable
derivedColumn.description: Returns whether or not a Transaction can be directly edited versus needing to offset the transaction or void/recreate the transaction. For all Transaction subtypes, returns true if the status is null. For Reserves and RecoveryReserves, returns true if the transaction is unapproved or rejected and its exposure is not closed. For Payments and Recoveries, returns true if the transaction has not been submitted.

foreignKey.name: Exposure
foreignKey.description: The related exposure.

array.name: LineItems
array.description: Set of line items that further categorize the transaction amount.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

derivedColumn.name: NotApproved
derivedColumn.description:
Returns true if the LifeCycleState indicates the transaction is unapproved or rejected. Specifically, if the LifeCycleState is one of the following:
  • TransactionLifeCycleState.DRAFT
  • TransactionLifeCycleState.PENDINGAPPROVAL
  • TransactionLifeCycleState.REJECTED

array.name: Offsets
array.description: Transactions that offset this transaction. A transaction should have at most one item in this array. This array is applicable only to a payment or recovery.

array.name: Onsets
array.description: Transactions that onset this transaction. This array is applicable only to a payment or recovery.

derivedColumn.name: OverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate
derivedColumn.description: False if the TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount ExchangeRate is a Market Rate (Automatic) or true if it's a user-entered custom rate for this Transaction (Manual).

derivedColumn.name: OverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate
derivedColumn.description: False if the TransactionAmount to ReservingAmount ExchangeRate is a Market Rate (Automatic) or true if it's a user-entered custom rate for this Transaction (Manual).

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

typekey.name: RecoveryCategory
typekey.description: User-defined subcategory of a recovery.

derivedColumn.name: ReportingAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the reporting amount of this transaction, which is the equivalent of transaction amount in the reporting currency. The amount is determined by summing the reporting amounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

foreignKey.name: ReserveLine
foreignKey.description: The ReserveLine associated with this transaction. For all transaction subtypes this ReserveLine will have matching Claim, Exposure, CostType and CostCategory.

derivedColumn.name: ReservingAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the Reserving amount of this transaction, which is the amount of this transaction in the Reserving Currency. The amount is determined by summing the ReservingAmounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

typekey.name: ReservingCurrency
typekey.description: Reserving Currency of this transaction's ReserveLine. Indicates the currency in which reserves are to be set aside and eroded.

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

derivedColumn.name: RoundingMode
derivedColumn.description: Gets the rounding mode that should be used when converting amounts between transaction, reserving, claim, and reporting currency for this transaction. See also CCCurrencyUtil.getRoundingMode().

typekey.name: Status
typekey.description: Status of the transaction. Further refines the LifeCycleState. Can only change status directly to another status in the same LifeCycleState, which does not affect Taccounts.

column.name: SubmitDate
column.description: Unused. May be removed in a future release.

typekey.name: Subtype
typekey.description: Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value

array.name: TAccountTransactions
array.description: Set of T-account transactions that make up the lifecycle of this Transaction.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the transaction amount of this transaction. The currency of the transaction amount may differ from the Claim currency. The amount is determined by summing the transaction amounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionAmountComponent
derivedColumn.description: Returns the TransactionAmount and ClaimAmount of this transaction as a CurrencyAmountPair.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionAmountDirectlyLineItem
derivedColumn.description: Ensures there is one and only one line item, ala setAmountDirectly, and then returns that TransactionLineItem. Only works for editable transactions.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionAmountReservingAmountPair
derivedColumn.description: Returns the TransactionAmount and ReservingAmount of this transaction as an IPairedMoney.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionDate
derivedColumn.description: Returns the date of this transaction. For any Transaction subtype other than Payment, this is simply the CreateTime. For Payments, it is the IssueDate of the Payment's associated Check, if not null, otherwise it it the ScheduledSendDate of the check.

foreignKey.name: TransactionSet
foreignKey.description: Set that groups together one or more transactions for approval.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionTypeName
derivedColumn.description: Returns the type of the transaction subtype: Payment, Reserve, Recovery, RecoveryReserve. Value is localized.

foreignKey.name: TransToClaimExchangeRate
foreignKey.description: ExchangeRate to use when converting TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount. Setting this value updates the claim and reporting amounts. Also sets the same ExchangeRate as TransToReservingExchangeRate if ClaimCurrency and ReservingCurrency are equal.

derivedColumn.name: TransToClaimExchangeRateRate
derivedColumn.description: Get the TransToClaimExchangeRate entity and check that it matches the current Currency, or lookup the current Market Exchange Rate entity. Return the ER entity's Rate. Or return ONE if it's null and/or in SINGLE currency mode.

foreignKey.name: TransToReservingExchangeRate
foreignKey.description: ExchangeRate to use when converting TransactionAmount to ReservingAmount. Setting this value updates the reserving amounts. Also sets the same ExchangeRate as TransToClaimExchangeRate if ClaimCurrency and ReservingCurrency are equal.

derivedColumn.name: TransToReservingExchangeRateRate
derivedColumn.description: Get the TransToReservingExchangeRate entity and check that it matches the current Currency, or lookup the current Market Exchange Rate entity. Return the ER entity's Rate. Or return ONE if it's null and/or in SINGLE currency mode.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

subtype.description:
A subtype of Transaction that represents a payment of money. One or more Payments belong to a Check, which delivers the money to a particular payee. Like all transactions, a Payment has a ReserveLine which categorizes the payment. Usually, there must be sufficient reserves on a ReserveLine for a Payment on that ReserveLine to be allowed.

Payments can be eroding or non-eroding. Eroding payments deplete Reserves on the same ReserveLine. A payment can be manually set to non-eroding so it does not deplete reserves. Some customers use non-eroding payments exclusively. Others may not allow non-eroding payments at all, except for supplemental payments.

Payments can be of three types: Partial, Final, and Supplemental. A partial payment is eroding. A Final payment is eroding, and sets the reserves on its ReserveLine to zero when its send date is reached. A Supplemental payment is made after the payment's Exposure or Claim has been closed, and is non-eroding.

derivedColumn.name: AppliedDeductible
derivedColumn.description: Returns the deductible applied to a line item on this payment, if one exists. If a value would be returned, it is the same as SharedDeductible. If no such deductible exists, a UserDisplayableException is thrown.

foreignKey.name: Check
foreignKey.description: Check that paid this payment.

derivedColumn.name: ClaimForExAdjustmentAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's claim currency amount.

column.name: CloseClaim
column.description: If this transaction is a final payment, this indicates whether it should or did close its associated claim.

column.name: CloseExposure
column.description: If this transaction is a final payment, this indicates whether it should or did close its associated exposure.

column.name: DoesNotErodeReserves
column.description: Indicates whether this payment should not erode reserves for its ReserveLine. This field can only be set in the CheckWizard UI. Otherwise, one of the setAsEroding() or setAsNonEroding() methods must be called from a rule to change whether a payment erodes reserves.

derivedColumn.name: ErodesReserves
derivedColumn.description: Whether this payment should erode reserves for its ReserveLine. This property is merely the negation of the DoesNotErodeReserves property. NOTE: This property must only be set in the CheckWizard UI. Anywhere else, use {@link #setAsEroding()} or {@link #setAsNonEroding}.

derivedColumn.name: ExceedsAvailableReserves
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if any of the payment's line items exceeds its available reserves.

derivedColumn.name: FirstLineItem
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves or creates the first line item in this payment's array of line-items. The line item's linecategory is set to null as a side-effect. Note that array order may be non-deterministic, so this will only have consistent behavior if there is zero or one line item.

derivedColumn.name: FuturePayment
derivedColumn.description: Tests if this payment has a check and that check's scheduled send date is in the future.

foreignKey.name: Matter
foreignKey.description: Foreign key to Matter

derivedColumn.name: OffsetPayment
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment offsets another payment.

derivedColumn.name: OffsettingReserve
derivedColumn.description: Returns the offsetting reserve associated with this payment if one exists.

derivedColumn.name: Onset
derivedColumn.description: Returns the onset payment associated with this payment if one exists. An onset exists for payments that have been recoded, transferred, or uncanceled (i.e., voided or stopped, but then eventually issued and/or cleared)

derivedColumn.name: OnsetOriginPayment
derivedColumn.description:
If this is an onset payment, retrieves the payment from which this onset was originally copied. If this is not an onset payment, returns NULL.

Note: When used in the UI, it is recommended that this method only be used from a single payment's detail screen, rather than a listview of payments or transactions, as it may require a direct query to the database to find the original payment.

derivedColumn.name: OnsetPayment
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment is the onset for another payment.

derivedColumn.name: PaymentBeingOffset
derivedColumn.description: If this is an offset payment, retrieves the payment that is being offset. If this is not an offset payment, returns NULL.

typekey.name: PaymentType
typekey.description: Type of the payment.

derivedColumn.name: Recodeable
derivedColumn.description: Only submitted payments that have not been recoded, and are not already the offset for a different payment, can be recoded.

derivedColumn.name: Recoded
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment has been recoded.

derivedColumn.name: RecodingOffset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment is the offset for a recoded payment.

derivedColumn.name: RecodingOnset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this Payment is the onset for a recoded payment.

derivedColumn.name: ReportingForExAdjustmentAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's reporting currency amount.

derivedColumn.name: RequiredPaymentType
derivedColumn.description: Checks if there is just one appropriate payment type based on a CostType and characteristics of an exposure such as its state, open reserve value, etc. For example, for a closed exposure the only appropriate payment type is "Supplement".

derivedColumn.name: ReservingForExAdjustmentAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the foreign-exchange adjustment made to this payment's reserving currency amount.

derivedColumn.name: SharedDeductible
derivedColumn.description: Returns this payment's exposure's coverage's deductible (which will be identical for all payments that have the same exposure) if it exists. Note that the deductible returned, if paid, may not necessarily be paid by this payment. The returned value may be null.

derivedColumn.name: StopOffset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment is the offset for a stopped payment.

derivedColumn.name: Stopped
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment has been stopped.

derivedColumn.name: StopVoidOnset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment exists as an offset for a payment for which a stop or void was attempted but failed. Specifically, the associated check was stopped or voided through the ClaimCenter UI, but then marked as {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.TransactionStatus#TC_ISSUED} or {@link TransactionStatus#TC_CLEARED} via an API call.

derivedColumn.name: Supplement
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this is a supplement payment (i.e., its payment type is 'supplement').

derivedColumn.name: TransferOffset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment is the offset for a transferred payment.

derivedColumn.name: TransferOnset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this Payment is the onset for a transferred payment.

derivedColumn.name: Transferred
derivedColumn.description: True if this payment has been transferred.

derivedColumn.name: Valid
derivedColumn.description:
Used in the UI to determine if a given payment should be allowed. Returns true if
  • The payment does not exceed reserves OR
  • The payment's exposure is null (not set up yet) OR
  • The financials configuration allows payments to exceed reserves OR
  • The payment's paymenttype is Supplement OR
  • The given payment belongs to a manual check OR
  • The payment's exposure does not have Reserves that belong to it

Otherwise returns false.

derivedColumn.name: ValidExposures
derivedColumn.description:
Retrieves the complete set of valid exposures for this payment (as an array).
  1. If payment is for a manual check, then all Exposures on the claim are valid
  2. If payment is not for a manual check, then only exposures against which a payment can be made are included. This includes:
    • Exposure is closed and previous payments have been made on it
    • Exposure is open and global PaymentExceedsReserves = true
    • Exposure is open and no reserves have been created for the exposure
    • Exposure is open and has available reserves on any costtype

derivedColumn.name: Voided
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment has been voided.

derivedColumn.name: VoidOffset
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this payment is the offset for a voided payment.

subtype.description: Records money that reduces a claim's liability, received from such sources as subrogation, salvage, other insurance, copayments, or deductibles. Equivalent to a negative Payment. A subtype of Transaction.

foreignKey.name: ClaimContact
foreignKey.description: Person or company from whom the recovery was obtained.

foreignKey.name: OBOClaimContact
foreignKey.description: Person or company responsible for paying.

derivedColumn.name: OffsetRecovery
derivedColumn.description: If this recovery is offsetting another recovery, returns true.

foreignKey.name: OffsettingRecoveryReserve
foreignKey.description: The RecoveryReserve, if any, that exists as a direct offset for this Recovery.

derivedColumn.name: OnBehalfOf
derivedColumn.description: Payer. Shortcut for ClaimContact.Contact.

derivedColumn.name: Payer
derivedColumn.description: Payer. Shortcut for ClaimContact.Contact.

foreignKey.name: PayerDenorm
foreignKey.description: Payer FK denorm.

derivedColumn.name: Recodeable
derivedColumn.description: Returns true iff all the following conditions for this recovery hold: This recovery is not new. This recovery has neither an onset nor an offset recovery. This recovery is not an offset for another recovery. This recovery has a status of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED.

derivedColumn.name: RecoveryBeingOffset
derivedColumn.description: If this is an offset recovery, retrieves the recovery that is being offset. If this is not an offset recovery, returns NULL.

derivedColumn.name: Resubmittable
derivedColumn.description:
True if this recovery is resubmittable. Specifically, its status is one of the following:
  • {@link gw.cc.financials.typekey.TransactionStatus#TC_DENIED}
and it is not an offset recovery.

derivedColumn.name: Transferable
derivedColumn.description: Returns true iff all the following conditions for this recovery hold: This recovery is not new. This recovery has neither an onset nor an offset recovery. This recovery is not an offset for another recovery. This recovery has a status of SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED.

derivedColumn.name: UseRecoveryReserves
derivedColumn.description: True if the system is configured to use recovery reserves.

derivedColumn.name: Voidable
derivedColumn.description: Identifies whether a Recovery entity is voidable or not. An entity is voidable if it is not a an offset recovery and its TransactionStatus status is SUBMITTING or SUBMITTED.

subtype.description: A subtype of Transaction that indicates money expected to be recovered. These reserves are depleted by Recovery transactions. Not commonly used, and ClaimCenter can be globally configured to not use RecoveryReserves at all. However, if ClaimCenter is configured to use them, and a Recovery is created with an amount that exceeds the open recovery reserves (total Recovery Reserves minus Total Recoveries) on that particular ReserveLine, then a RecoveryReserve in the proper amount is automatically created to keep open recovery reserves from becoming negative.

A subtype of Transaction that sets aside money to cover expected costs. Like every Transaction, a Reserve has a ReserveLine, for which the Reserve transaction increases reserves. Reserves are depleted by eroding payments. To get the total reserves, open reserves, remaining reserves or available reserves, use the FinancialsCalculationUtil class.

derivedColumn.name: GroupedReserves
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves all Reserves from this reserve's TransactionSet, regardless of whether the reserves are part of a ReserveSet, or if they are instead associated with a CheckSet (as CheckSetReserves).

derivedColumn.name: MatchingPendingReserves
derivedColumn.description: The total claim amount of pending approval reserves that match this reserve on this reserve's Claim, Exposure, CostType and CostCategory.

derivedColumn.name: OffsetPayment
derivedColumn.description: If this Reserve exists to offset a payment directly, because the payment exceeds reserves, this method returns the payment being offset. If no such payment exists, this method returns NULL.

derivedColumn.name: TotalIncurredGross
derivedColumn.description: The Total Incurred Gross calculation for the ReserveLine of this reserve.

derivedColumn.name: ZeroingOffset
derivedColumn.description: Returns whether this reserve is a zeroing offset, i.e. if its offset payment is not null.

entity.description: Wraps a Transaction to keep track of a new amount entered by the user. Used with TransactionWizardHelper. Internally stores an amount in the claim currency and in the currency of the transaction.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: Currency
derivedColumn.description: Gets the value of Transaction.Currency

derivedColumn.name: ExchangeRateRate
derivedColumn.description: Gets the value of Transaction.TransToReservingExchangeRateRate

derivedColumn.name: NewAmountInReservingCurrency
derivedColumn.description: Gets an IMutableMoney to be used for editing the amount in the reserving currency. When the amount is mutated, the amount is saved to the internal reserving amount and transaction amount properties, and the Transaction's currency is set to it's reserving currency.

derivedColumn.name: NewAmountInTransactionCurrency
derivedColumn.description: Gets an IMutablePairedMoney to be used for editing the amount in the transaction currency. The secondary amount is equal to the internal reserving amount.

derivedColumn.name: OverrideExchangeRate
derivedColumn.description: Gets the value of Transaction.OverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate

column.name: PrevBaseAmount
column.description: The base amount in the reserving currency for the reserve line corresponding to this row. This is intended to help determine whether the base amount has changed and therefore whether the amount properties should be reset when the reserve line changes.

typekey.name: PrevReservingCurrency
typekey.description: The previous reserving currency for the reserve line corresponding to this row. This is intended to help determine whether the reserving currency has changed and therefore whether the amount properties should be reset when the reserve line changes.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

foreignKey.name: Transaction
foreignKey.description: Wrapped transaction.

entity.description: Transaction ids sent to create the illusion of idempotency

column.name: CreationTime
column.description: Time of creating the transaction id.

column.name: tid
column.description: Unique transaction id

entity.description: TransactionLineItems provide a means to split the amount of a transaction into multiple categories (e.g., Doctor, Hospital, Legal, Other, etc.). Every transaction has one or more TransactionLineItems, and the amount of the transaction is the aggregate amount of all its line items.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

derivedColumn.name: Amount
derivedColumn.description:
Equivalent to TransactionAmount. Provided for backwards compatibility on SINGLE currency mode servers.

To set this amount when appropriate, call {@link #setTransactionAmountAndUpdate(gw.api.financials.CurrencyAmount)}.

column.name: ClaimAmount
column.description: The amount of this line item in the Claim's currency.

derivedColumn.description: Gets this line item's claim's currency. Required by the "CurrencyAmount" currencyProperty to resolve the claim currency.

column.name: ClaimForExAmount
column.description: The foreign exchange adjustment for this line item in the claim currency. This stores the amount by which the current value of ClaimAmount exceeds its original value.

column.name: Comments
column.description: A note or description of the line item.

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

derivedColumn.description: Gets this line item's currency. Required by the "CurrencyAmount" currencyProperty to resolve the transaction currency.

foreignKey.name: Deductible
foreignKey.description: The deductible for which this transaction line item is applied, if any.

typekey.name: LineCategory
typekey.description: The category of this line item.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

column.name: ReportingAmount
column.description: The amount of this line item in the app's default currency (reporting currency).

column.name: ReportingForExAmount
column.description: The foreign exchange adjustment for this line item in the reporting currency. This stores the amount by which the current value of ReportingAmount exceeds its original value.

column.name: ReservingAmount
column.description: The amount of this line item in the Currency of the ReserveLine (ReservingCurrency).

derivedColumn.name: ReservingCurrency
derivedColumn.description: Gets this line item's reserving currency. Required by the "CurrencyAmount" currencyProperty to resolve the reserving currency.

column.name: ReservingForExAmount
column.description: The foreign exchange adjustment for this line item in the reserving currency. This stores the amount by which the current value of ReservingAmount exceeds its original value.

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

foreignKey.name: Transaction
foreignKey.description: The parent transaction.

column.name: TransactionAmount
column.description: The amount of this line item, in the transaction currency.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionAmountComponent
derivedColumn.description: Get this line item's TransactionAmount and ClaimAmount as an IPairedMoney. This is for editing in the UI only. Use TransactionAmount or ClaimAmount in Gosu.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionAmountReservingAmountPair
derivedColumn.description: Get this line item's TransactionAmount and ReservingAmount as an IPairedMoney. This is for editing in the UI only. Use TransactionAmount or ReservingAmount in Gosu.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionCurrencyAmount
derivedColumn.description: Set TransactionAmount, then updates the Claim amount and Reporting amount.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

derivedColumn.name: ValidLineCategories
derivedColumn.description: Returns a list of valid line categories for this line item. The full list of line categories is first filtered by its categories. If the line item currently has a line category of "Deductible" or "FormerDeductible", no further filtering is done. Otherwise, "Deductible" and "FormerDeductible" are removed from the list.

entity.description: A TransactionOffset relates a transaction to its offsetting transaction (if any). It contains two links, one to the original transaction and one to its offsetting transaction. A TransactionOffset is created whenever a user recodes or transfers a payment in ClaimCenter, and also when a user voids/stops a payment. In the case of a recode or transfer the Offsetting transaction is just a negative copy of the original payment.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

foreignKey.name: Offset
foreignKey.description: The offset transaction, to negate the original transaction.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

foreignKey.name: Transaction
foreignKey.description: The transaction being offset.

entity.description: A TransactionOnset relates a transaction to its onsetting transactions (if any). It contains two links, one to the original transaction and one to the new onset transaction. A TransactionOnset is created whenever a user recodes or transfers a payment in ClaimCenter. In the case of a recode or transfer the onset payment has the same line items as the original payment but a different ReserveLine coding.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

foreignKey.name: Onset
foreignKey.description: The onset (recode or transfer) transaction, same as the original but on the new ReserveLine/Claim.

column.name: OnsetPublicID
column.description: PublicID of the onset, used when the FK to the onset has been severed for archiving.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

foreignKey.name: Transaction
foreignKey.description: The transaction being onset.

derivedColumn.description: obtains the TransactionAmount and ReservingAmount properties as a CurrencyAmount (to allow multicurrency display). This method can be used in the RecoverySearchResultsLV.pcf if the customer wishes to see the recovery's amount in both the transaction and reserving currencies.

derivedColumn.name: TransactionCurrencyAmount
derivedColumn.description: Obtains the amount of the recovery in the transaction currency as a CurrencyAmount so that the correct currency icon is displayed. However, even if this recovery were not created in its claim's currency only the transaction currency amount will be displayed.

entity.description: A set of transactions submitted for approval together. Subtypes include ReserveSet, RecoverySet, and RecoveryReserveSet, which contain the respective Transaction types. A CheckSet contains Checks and Payments. There is no PaymentSet.

column.name: ID
column.description: Internally managed primary key

array.name: Activities
array.description: Set of approval / approval denial activities linked to this transaction set.

derivedColumn.name: AllTransactions
derivedColumn.description: Returns all transactions that belong to this TransactionSet. For CheckSets, this also returns any offsetting reserves and payments on add-ons. <p/> Subclasses need to implement this.

column.name: ApprovalDate
column.description: The date when the object was ultimately approved or rejected

derivedColumn.name: ApprovalHistory
derivedColumn.description: Retrieves all approval activities for this TransactionSet.

typekey.name: ApprovalStatus
typekey.description: The approval status of the object

derivedColumn.name: Approved
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if the TransactionSet is approved, i.e., its approval status is {@link gw.pl.community.typekey.ApprovalStatus#TC_APPROVED}.

foreignKey.name: Claim
foreignKey.description: The claim entity to which this TransactionSet belongs.

derivedColumn.name: ClaimAmount
derivedColumn.description: Returns the sum total of all the transactions' claim amount in this set, including dependent checks and offsetting reserves (where applicable).

column.name: CreateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was created

foreignKey.name: CreateUser
foreignKey.description: User who created the object

array.name: Documents
array.description: Set of documents linked to this transaction set.

derivedColumn.name: Editable
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if the TransactionSet is editable, i.e., it is unapproval or rejected.

derivedColumn.name: ExceedsApplicableLimit
derivedColumn.description: For all aggregate limits that the transactions on this TransactionSet contribute to, returns true if any limit's used amount is greater than its corresponding limit amount. <p/> Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

derivedColumn.name: ExceedsApplicableLimitIgnoringStatus
derivedColumn.description: For all aggregate limits that the transactions on this TransactionSet contribute to, returns true if any limit's used amount is greater than its corresponding limit amount. The amount used includes all transactions in this TransactionSet regardless of their status. <p/> Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

derivedColumn.name: ExceedsLimit
derivedColumn.description: Returns true if this TransactionSet, when combined with all other TransactionSets for all aggregate limits that apply to the Policy of this TransactionSet's claim, returns true if any limit used is greater than its corresponding limit amount.<p/> Defaults to Limit. <p/> Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

derivedColumn.name: ExceedsLimitIgnoringStatus
derivedColumn.description: For all aggregate limits belonging to the policy of the TransactionSet's claim, returns true if any limit used is greater than its corresponding limit amount. The amount used includes all transactions in this TransactionSet regardless of their status. <p/> Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

derivedColumn.name: Exposures
derivedColumn.description: Returns the list of exposures that the transactions in this TransactionSet belong to.

derivedColumn.name: LastApprovingUser
derivedColumn.description: Returns the last user who approved this TransactionSet. <p/> For example, if User A submits a TransactionSet for approval, then the LastApprovingUser is User A. Suppose that TransactionSet then requires approval by User B. When User B approves the TransactionSet, then the LastApprovingUser becomes User B. And so on . . . <p/> Note: This method should only be called from Approval and Transaction Approval Rules. If this method is called from any other rule, then returns null.

derivedColumn.name: LineItems
derivedColumn.description: Returns all transaction line items that belong to this TransactionSet.

derivedColumn.name: LinkedDocuments
derivedColumn.description: Returns the set of Documents linked to this TransactionSet.

column.name: LoadCommandID
column.description: LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.

column.name: PublicID
column.description: ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped

foreignKey.name: RequestingUser
foreignKey.description: The user submitting the object for approval

derivedColumn.name: Retired
derivedColumn.description: True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

typekey.name: Subtype
typekey.description: Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value

derivedColumn.name: Transactions
derivedColumn.description: Returns all transactions that belong to this TransactionSet. For CheckSets, this only returns the payments of the primary and recurrence checks. <p/> Subclasses need to implement this.

column.name: UpdateTime
column.description: Timestamp when the object was last updated

foreignKey.name: UpdateUser
foreignKey.description: User who last updated the object

derivedColumn.name: ValidationResult
derivedColumn.description: Gets the validation result.

subtype.description: A subtype of TransactionSet which contains a Check. May contain more than one Check if its a multi-payee check (in a CheckGroup) and/or RecurringCheck. It may also contain Reserve transactions if its payments affect reserves (like a Final payment or a payment that exceeds Available Reserves). Submitted as a unit for approval. Each of the payment transactions for all the checks in a checkset also link back to the CheckSet.

array.name: CheckGroups
array.description: The check groups of multi-payee checks contained in the check set, if any.

array.name: Checks
array.description: All checks contained in the check set.

derivedColumn.name: ExceedsAvailableReserves
derivedColumn.description: check if checkSet transactions exceeds available reserves. Can be used in rules regardless of approval status or other status changes.

derivedColumn.name: FirstEditableCheckGroup
derivedColumn.description: Returns the first editable check group. In certain cases the earliest check group is not editable. This provides the UI with the most appropriate check group for modification.

derivedColumn.name: ForBulkedCheck
derivedColumn.description: Tests whether this CheckSet is for a bulked check (i.e., contains one and only one check, which is also associated with a BulkInvoiceItem).

derivedColumn.name: PaymentsAmount
derivedColumn.description: The sum of all payments in this CheckSet, in the Check currency. All Checks in a CheckSet have the same currency, which can be accessed as checkSet.PrimaryCheck.Currency

derivedColumn.name: PrimaryCheck
derivedColumn.description: Gets the primary check with the earliest scheduled send date from this CheckSet. If there are no primary checks, gets an arbitrary check. Returns null if there are no checks.

derivedColumn.name: PrimaryChecksSortedByDate
derivedColumn.description: The primary checks in this CheckSet sorted by scheduled send date (ascending).

derivedColumn.name: PrimaryEditableCheck
derivedColumn.description: Returns the earliest check, according to ScheduledSendDate, that is both primary and editable. For use when editing a recurring check, in case the first checks in the list have already been escalated.

foreignKey.name: Recurrence
foreignKey.description: The recurrence schedule for the check set, if it has one.

derivedColumn.name: Recurring
derivedColumn.description: True if this CheckSet is a recurring CheckSet.

array.name: RecurringChecks
array.description: Recurring checks (if any) that make up this check set.

array.name: Reserves
array.description: Reserves that should be approved or rejected along with the set.

subtype.description: A TransactionSet of one or more RecoveryReserves created and submitted together for approval.

array.name: RecoveryReserves
array.description: Recovery reserves in the set.

subtype.description: A TransactionSet of one or more Recoveries created and submitted together for approval.

array.name: Recoveries
array.description: The recoveries in the set.

subtype.description: Subtype of TransactionSet that contains one or more reserve transactions submitted together for approval.

array.name: Reserves
array.description: Reserves in the set.

derivedColumn.description: Returns a Set of all the groups to which this user belongs or has admin rights to.

derivedColumn.description: Returns all GroupUser entities *from the database* that point to this user. To retrieve GroupUsers that are only in the bundle as well, try getAllGropuUsersAsArray() on the product's User implementation.

derivedColumn.name: SafeToDelete
derivedColumn.description:
Tests if the user can be safely deleted. Returns false if
  • The user is the super user
  • The user is the "default owner", used as the assignee of last resort by the assignment system
  • The user supervises any groups
  • Any items are assigned to the user

typekey.description: Indicates the type of special system users (for example, default claim owner). This is null for regular users.

typekey.name: TimeZone
typekey.description: User's time zone.

derivedColumn.name: TotalUserWorkload
derivedColumn.description: Virtual property which returns the total workload for a user, based on previously calculated workload. The total workload is the sum of all workloads of the user in all groups. The value is zero if this user is ineligible. Total Workload is always a non-negative, non-null value.

derivedColumn.name: UnrestrictedUser
derivedColumn.description: Indicates whether or not this user is the super user that should be granted all permissions.

entity.description: Represents the combined statistics for a given user in a group. This entity aggregates claim, exposure, and activity statistics. Refer to the DashboardStats entity for statistics displayed for a user or in the dashboard.

column.description: Number of open activities for the given user/group.

column.description: Number of open matters for the given user/group.

column.name: AllOpen
column.description: Number of open claims for the given user/group.

column.name: AllSubOpen
column.description: Number of open exposures for the given user/group.

column.name: CalculateDate
column.description: Date when statistics were calculated.

column.name: ClaimAgingFour
column.description: Number of open claims falling into the fourth aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: ClaimAgingOne
column.description: Number of open claims falling into the first aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: ClaimAgingThree
column.description: Number of open claims falling into the third aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: ClaimAgingTwo
column.description: Number of open claims falling into the second aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: ClosedThisWeek
column.description: Number of claims closed in the time window. Note that the window is now customizable, so this may not actually correspond to the current week, but the column name cannot be easily changed.

column.name: CompletedToday
column.description: Number of activities completed today.

column.name: DueToday
column.description: Number of activities due today.

column.name: ExpAgingFour
column.description: Number of open exposures falling into the fourth aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: ExpAgingThree
column.description: Number of open exposures falling into the third aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: ExpAgingTwo
column.description: Number of open exposures falling into the second aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: Flagged
column.description: Number of flagged claims for the given user/group.

column.name: LitAgingFour
column.description: Number of open and litigated claims falling into the fourth aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: LitAgingOne
column.description: Number of open and litigated claims falling into the first aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: LitAgingThree
column.description: Number of open and litigated claims falling into the third aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

column.name: LitAgingTwo
column.description: Number of open and litigated claims falling into the second aging bucket (the divisions are customer-configurable).

foreignKey.description: Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeAndGroupDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing the current assignee plus their group, suitable for display to the user. This can be quite a long string, for example "Andy Applegate (Auto1 - TeamA)". See also {@link #getAssigneeDisplayString()} which omits the group name and may be more appropriate if space is tight.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing the current assignee, suitable for display to the user. See also {@link #getAssigneeAndGroupDisplayString()}, which returns a more detailed description of the assignee.

derivedColumn.name: AssigneeGroupOnlyDisplayString
derivedColumn.description: Returns a string describing only the group of the current assignee, suitable for display to the user. See also {@link #getAssigneeAndGroupDisplayString()}, which returns a more detailed description of the assignee.

General validation error or warning raised on an entity

entity.description:
ValidationResult is used to read and write results of an object's validation (e.g. validation via rules, or field level validation).

ValidationResult stores both entity level errors (general errors not associated with a particular field) and field level errors (errors associated with a particular field on an entity).

A FieldValidation object can store the bad value which triggered the error (e.g. a mangled loss date that was imported with the claim) and may also suggests possible correct values, either as a list of objects or foreign keys (if the field is a foreign key, e.g. picking from a set of users with the last name "Shaw" if the imported ClaimDef only identifies "Shaw" as the owner). See FieldValidation to learn what information may be captured with an invalid field.

Types of validation failures for a Bulk Invoice.

typecode.name: Item claim is archived
typecode.description: One of the Bulk Invoice Items has been configured with an archived claim. The claim must be retrieved before it can be used.

typecode.name: Other
typecode.description: Other (jetski, canoe, kayak, johnboat, rowboat, etc.)

typecode.name: Item approved
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item has passed the bulk invoice approval process

typecode.name: Awaiting submission
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item and its check have passed approval and is ready to be escalated once the bulk invoice is ready to be escalated

typecode.name: Check pending approval
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item has passed the bulk invoice approval process and is waiting for its check to be approved

typecode.name: Draft
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item is possibly committed to the database, but is not yet ready for validation

typecode.name: In review
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item requires action before it can be paid. This value can be set when approving a bulk invoice.

typecode.name: Not valid
typecode.description: Payment/check associated with the bulk invoice item failed validation

typecode.name: Pending stop
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item was stopped, and confirmation of stop is pending

typecode.name: Pending transfer
typecode.description: Check associated with bulk invoice item was transferred, and acknowledgement of the transfer event message is pending

typecode.name: Pending void
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item was voided, and confirmation of void is pending

typecode.name: Rejected
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item was rejected by the bulk invoice approver

typecode.name: Submitted
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item was submitted to the downstream system

typecode.name: Submitting
typecode.description: Bulk invoice item is being submitted to downsteam system

typecode.name: Transferred
typecode.description: Check associated with bulk invoice item was transferred

typelist.description: Job type describing the process for which a bulk invoice work item is created

typecode.name: Awaiting submission
typecode.description: Awaiting submission to the downstream system

typecode.name: Cleared
typecode.description: Bulk invoice's associated bulk check has been cleared

typecode.name: Draft
typecode.description: Bulk invoice is possibly committed to DB, but not yet ready for validation

typecode.name: Invalid bulk invoice items
typecode.description: One or more approved items on the bulk invoice failed validation or had some problem with the associated check

typecode.name: Issued
typecode.description: Bulk invoice's associated bulk check has been issued

typecode.name: On hold
typecode.description: Bulk invoice was put on hold by downstream system

typecode.name: Pending bulk invoice item validation
typecode.description: Individual bulk invoice items are being validated

typecode.name: Pending stop
typecode.description: Bulk invoice was stopped, and confirmation of stop is pending

typecode.name: Pending void
typecode.description: Bulk invoice was voided, and confirmation of void is pending

typecode.name: Rejected
typecode.description: Bulk invoice rejected by assigned approver

typecode.name: Requested
typecode.description: Sent to downstream system and acknowledged

typecode.name: Requesting
typecode.description: Queued for submission to the downstream system

typecode.name: Application-specific check
typecode.description: Verifies application-specific relationships in the database

typecode.name: Array required match
typecode.description: Verifies that every row in the container has a nonempty array

typecode.name: Assignment check
typecode.description: Verifies that the database is consistent relative to assignment

typecode.name: Bean version check
typecode.description: Verifies that the database is consistent relative to bean versions

typecode.name: Linguistic search denorm check
typecode.description: Verifies that the linguistic search denorm columns are in sync with the associated source columns

typecode.name: Check constraint check
typecode.description: Verifies data is valid relative to check constraints

typecode.name: Consistent children
typecode.description: Verifies that the consistent children property holds

typecode.name: Custom check
typecode.description: Custom consistency check declared in a data model file

typecode.name: Datetime ordering check
typecode.description: Verifies data is valid relative to datetime orderings

typecode.name: Edge foreign key non-null check
typecode.description: Verifies that non-nullable edge foreign key relationships have one referring entity

typecode.name: Effdated registry check
typecode.description: Verifies that an effdated table appears in the effdated registry of all referenced branches

typecode.name: Foreign key check
typecode.description: Verifies foreign key references when RI is not enforced in the database

typecode.name: Foreign key subtype check
typecode.description: Verifies foreign key reference to a subtype is to correct subtype

typecode.name: Join table check
typecode.description: Verifies data is valid relative to jointable declarations

typecode.name: Localized column check
typecode.description: Verifies required localized columns have values for all languages

typecode.name: Max key check
typecode.description: Verifies data in max key table is in synch with table

typecode.name: One-to-one check
typecode.description: Verifies that one-to-one relationships have at most one referring entity

typecode.name: One-to-one non-null check
typecode.description: Verifies that non-nullable one-to-one relationships have one referring entity

typecode.name: Revisioning check
typecode.description: Verifies that the database is consistent relative to revisioning

typecode.name: Search denorm check
typecode.description: Verifies that the search denorm columns are in sync with the associated source columns

typecode.name: Subtype column check
typecode.description: Verifies subtype column contains valid values

typecode.name: Subtype non-null check
typecode.description: Verifies non-nullable subtype-specific columns have non-null values for subtype rows

typecode.name: Subtype-specific column check
typecode.description: Verifies subtype-specific columns are null when row is a different subtype

typecode.name: Typekey check
typecode.description: Verifies typekey column contains valid values

typecode.name: Typelist table check
typecode.description: Verifies values in typelist table and data model are in sync

typecode.name: Upgrade warning check
typecode.description: Verifies that data will pass associated version check at the beginning of the upgrade to a subsequent version of the product

typelist.description: Represents the result of definitive match search.

typecode.name: Close match
typecode.description: At least one contact in the Address Book closely matched a given contact.

typecode.name: Implausible match
typecode.description: A definitive match was found, but the contact does not match in terms of potential match fields.

typecode.name: Incompatible type match
typecode.description: A definitive match was found, but its type is incompatible with the type of the candidate contact. That is, the matched contact could not be cast to the type of the candidate contact.

typecode.name: Plausible match
typecode.description: A definitive match was found that matches a contact in the Address Book in terms of potential match fields.

typecode.name: Plausible match
typecode.description: One or more contacts in the Address Book possibly matched a given contact.

typelist.description: State transitions for all kinds of service requests. An operation is executed by calling serviceRequest.performOperation(OPERATION, context, commitInNewBundle) or invoice.performOperation(OPERATION, context, commitInNewBundle). Each operation (as defined in the StateHandler classes) holds information about when it should be available, the Progress and QuoteStatus states to move to after the operation, a display name, and an optional action to take.

typecode.name: Draft
typecode.description: The service is still being edited and has not yet been sent to the vendor

typecode.name: In Progress
typecode.description: The vendor is authorized to perform the work

typecode.name: Requested
typecode.description: Service request has been sent to the selected vendor, and has been acknowledged

typefilter.name: terminal

Internal status of a TAccountTransaction, as opposed to the business status of a transaction represented by the values in the TransactionStatus typelist

typecode.name: Awaiting submission
typecode.description: Transaction is waiting to be submitted to the downstream system

typecode.name: Committed
typecode.description: Transaction has been committed and is no longer editable

typecode.name: Draft
typecode.description: Transactions in this state have not yet been completed and submitted for approval

typecode.name: Future dated
typecode.description: Valid only for future dated payments

typecode.name: New
typecode.description: Transactions in this state are brand new, often with no lineitems yet, and not yet in DRAFT state

typecode.name: Pending approval
typecode.description: Transaction is moving through the approval process

typelist.description: The status of a transaction, from draft through approval to submission

typecode.name: Awaiting submission
typecode.description: Awaiting for the send date to arrive, at which point the status will change to Submitting (applicable only to payments)

typecode.name: Draft
typecode.description: Draft; not yet submitted to a back-end accounting system

typecode.name: Notifying
typecode.description: In the process of notifying the accounting system of a new manual check

typecode.name: Pending stop
typecode.description: A stop payment request is pending (applicable only to payments)

typecode.name: Pending transfer
typecode.description: Transaction that is pending transfer from one claim to another claim

typecode.name: Pending void
typecode.description: A void transaction request is pending (applicable only to payments and recoveries)

typecode.name: Rejected
typecode.description: Rejected by the user assigned to approve the transaction

typecode.name: Requested
typecode.description: Requested of the accounting system (applicable only to checks)

typecode.name: Requesting
typecode.description: In the process of being requested from the accounting system (applicable only to checks)

typecode.name: Stopped
typecode.description: A stop payment has been issued for this payment's check (applicable only to payments)

typecode.name: Submitting
typecode.description: In the process of being submitted to the accounting system

typecode.name: Transferred
typecode.description: Transaction that is transferred from one claim to another claim

typecode.name: Voided
typecode.description: The transaction is voided (applicable only to payments and recoveries)

typelist.description: The possible states of an active workflow object

typecode.name: Wait Activity
typecode.description: The workflow is waiting for some activities to complete.

typecode.name: Wait Timeout/Manual
typecode.description: The workflow is waiting for a trigger or timeout.

typecode.name: Wait Message
typecode.description: The workflow is waiting for a message to be acked.

typecode.name: Internal
typecode.description: Handled by Guidewire's internal Workflow engine

typecode.name: Test
typecode.description: Handled by testing infrastructure (not for production!)

typelist.description: The states a workflow object can be in

typecode.name: Completed
typecode.description: Completed -- the workflow reached one of its Outcomes.

typecode.name: Error
typecode.description: The workflow encountered an exception while running, so the it has been paused until the error is fixed.

typecode.name: Suspended
typecode.description: Suspended -- execution of the workflow was manually suspended. It can be resumed later.

typecode.name: Canceling
typecode.description: a WorkItemSet goes into this state when the user requests that we cease further processing. Workers will continue processing current WorkItems, but will not start new ones.

typecode.name: Completed
typecode.description: all WorkItems have been processed. Some WorkItems may have been successful and others may have failed

typecode.name: Processing
typecode.description: the WorkItemSet is being worked on, i.e. there is at least one WorkItem that has not been completed yet

typecode.name: Available
typecode.description: Work item that is available to be processed.

typecode.name: CheckedOut
typecode.description: Work item that is checked out.

typecode.name: Failed
typecode.description: Work item that exceeded the maximum number of allowed retries.

typefilter.name: YesNoOnly
typefilter.description: Only display Yes and No typelist values

typecode.name: Unknown
typecode.description: Placeholder typecode for fields that should be populated with another ZoneType
